Students act as attorneys and simulate a jury trial, preparing witnesses and writing and performing pre-trial motions, opening statements, direct and cross examinations, and closing arguments.

name: Thomistic Institute at Yale — Undergraduate Chapter
mission:
The Thomistic Institute exists to promote Catholic truth in our contemporary world by strengthening the intellectual formation of Christians at universities, in the Church, and in the wider public square. The thought of St. Thomas Aquinas, the Universal Doctor of the Church, is our touchstone. 
The Thomistic Institute is part of the Pontifical Faculty of the Immaculate Conception at the Dominican House of Studies in Washington, DC.

name: Tilting at Windmills
mission: Tilting at Windmills is a monthly political satire show, in the vein of The Daily Show and Last Week tonight. We aim to provide a balanced, reasonable perspective while making fun of the ridiculousness that is the world around us.

name: Yale Biomedical Chinese Students and Scholars Association
mission: Yale Biomedical Chinese Students and Scholars Association is an organization for intellectual exchange and resource sharing between hundreds of Chinese students and scholars in the biomedical field.

name: Timmy Global Health at Yale University – an Undergraduate Organization
mission: Timmy Global Health strives for health equity and empowers students to tackle today’s most pressing global health challenges. To achieve this goal, Timmy sends medical service teams to support the work of international partner organizations and channels financial, medical, and human resources to community-based health and development projects. Each chapter strives to empower volunteers to lead the fight for broad healthcare access and help deliver the promise of a healthy future.

name: Title IX Office
mission:
Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 is a federal law that protects people from sex and gender discrimination in educational programs and activities at institutions that receive federal financial assistance.  Title IX states that:
No person in the United States, on the basis of sex, shall be excluded from participation, be denied the benefits of, or be subjected to discrimination under any educational program or activity receiving Federal financial assistance.
Yale University is committed to providing an environment free from discrimination on the basis of sex or gender. Yale provides many resources to students, faculty, and staff to address concerns relating to discrimination on the basis of sex or gender in all aspects of the educational process.

name: Title IX Working Group
mission:
The Title IX Working Group is a group of students and administrators fighting gender-based violence and harassment on campus and beyond. We are working to create a safe, equitable space at the law school, and to address the systemic biases that often disadvantage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ people, people with disabilities, and members of other marginalized groups. In concert with Yale Law School’s active student organizations, we strive to create a community that supports every student.
To further this goal, the Title IX Working Group advises the law school administration on policies and advances efforts to improve campus climate and promote gender justice. We engage locally—fostering inclusive pedagogy and providing resources for survivors of sexual assault or harassment—and globally—researching and weighing in on national conversations about gender violence.
In the past few years, we’ve delivered results, including rolling out a law-school wide survey of sexual harassment and violence, making gender equity a focus point in biannual course evaluations, and creating a peer-lead program to offer support and informal resources to all students. We also meet regularly with faculty and administrators to discuss student concerns.
If you have and questions or concerns, or if you would like to join the Working Group, please contact one of the co-chairs of the Working Group: Grace Judge, Evan Walker-Wells, or Noelle Wyman

name: Toxics SIG
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups

name: Trans@Yale: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The three goals of Trans@Yale are: to provide a safe space for transgender and/or non-binary students to form a community that provides emotional support and any needed medical advice; to work with the Yale administration to provide respect and support, individually and institutionally, for trans and non-binary students; and to engage with larger-scale sociopolitical advocacy and activism around issues affecting the trans community as well as other communities fighting for rights and recognition. The first goal will be achieved through hosting social events and meetings where students can be themselves and feel comfortable and safe, as well as hosting workshops and talks on key trans issues. The second goal will be achieved through student activism, and also by working with the Office of LGBTQ Resources and the Yale Administration to find and rewrite policies that currently exclude trans/non-binary students and/or make being trans and participating in a Yale-affiliated activity unusually difficult. The third goal will be achieved also through student activism, as well as collaboration with other on-campus organizations and New Haven groups.

name: Trans@YLS
mission: Our mission is to support the trans community at YLS by creating safe spaces, connecting members, and advocating for our needs.
benefits:
We provide resources such as:
* Activities like movie night, board games, and crochet classes, as well as the occasional socially distant outdoor hang
* Academic advising
* Professional advising
* Unprofessional advising
* Emotional support
* Bringing cool speakers to campus - or to digital campus
* Co-developing advocacy strategies
* The inside scoop about what to expect in the classroom, on campus, and around New Haven.

name: Tsai Center for Innovative Thinking at Yale (CITY)
Turkish Society of Yale Graduate Students and Scholars
mission: Yale Turkish Society is a student organization at Yale University. This organization’s purpose shall be to foster a sense of community among Turkish graduates and post-graduates studying at Yale University.

name: Turkish Student Association of Yale College
mission: Yale Friends of Turkey is a student-run organization at Yale University that aims to connect a diverse group of members over topics related to Turkey and the Turkish Culture. Our activities involve cultural dinners with signature Turkish food,academic talks on Turkish politics, movie screenings and many other social gatherings.

name: Uncle Moisty and the Towelettes
mission: Uncle Moisty and the Towelettes aims to be a welcoming space for singers of all abilities and commitment levels. Halfway between singing and comedy group, specializing in Jewish and Jew-ish music, fun and funny, we combine performance, community, and comedy.

name: Undergraduate Cognitive Science Collective at Yale
mission: COGSCY aims to create a social and intellectual hub for Cognitive Science majors with various interests and levels of experience, so they can inspire and help each other regarding topics such as but not limited to: research, conferences, graduate school/industry, brainstorming ideas for a better world, being up-to-date with relevant pieces of literature.

name: Undergraduate Music Production Association at Yale
mission: The Undergraduate Music Production Association at Yale's mission is to serve as a hub of knowledge, generosity, and creativity within the scope of electronic music production. Our goals are to educate members about advanced production techniques, share access to music software that is otherwise inaccessible or too expensive, create a communicative social network for producers at Yale, and learn how to better incorporate production techniques into music works.
goals: To share and communicate musical production ideas and techniques to the community and one another.

name: Undergraduate Production
mission:
Undergraduate Production (UP) was established in 2000 to ensure safe practices in the planning, production, and presentation of undergraduate performing arts events. Over the subsequent years, Yale College’s performing arts culture has grown to encompass over 400 events, 2,500 students, and 30,000 audience experiences annually.
Yale University has a vast and vibrant performing arts culture. Within this rich environment, UP works exclusively with Yale undergraduates to ensure that their work gets the attention and support it needs. UP provides training and technical support for comedy, dance, music, opera, spoken word, theater, and interdisciplinary performance genres. We work on everything from large-scale projects, such as operas featuring dozens of cast members and musicians, to informal poetry slams.
Regardless of scope and scale, all student productions must be planned and developed in a manner that ensures the safety of the production team and the audience. UP exists to fulfill this mandate as we support both the artistic vision and the highest level of safety for each undergraduate production.

name: Unitarian Universalist Student Group
mission: The Unitarian Universalists Student Group provides support, denominational fellowship, and opportunities for education and theological reflection for Unitarian Universalist students at YDS, as well as Unitarian Universalist worship for the wider YDS community.

name: United Against Inequities in Disease
mission:
Our keystone objectives are to identify health inequities within New Haven through research and to implement projects with local organizations to lessen the impact of these inequities.
Through its event-planning and outreach, Yale UAID aims to bring New Haven-relevant public health discussions/information to Yale students and increase general awareness prevalence of health inequities in surrounding community, and bring health education/access to the New Haven public in need, whether that be in partnership with hospitals, clinics, non-profits, or schools in the area.

name: United Church of Westville
mission: We, the United Church of Westville, are a Christ-centered family committed to growing together in one spirit, loving and witnessing to the Yale campus and community, and humbly trusting in the grace and power of the Holy Spirit through prayer and obedience to the Word.

name: UNITY Korean Drum and Dance Troupe
category: Cultural, Performance: Instruments, AACC Affiliate Org
mission: Participating in and sharing the Korean cultural arts.

name: University Church in Yale
address:
Battell Chapel
New Haven, Conn
mission:
The University Church in Yale is a student-focused church welcoming Christian students of all backgrounds, as well as staff, faculty, post-docs, parents, alumnus/a, parents, and our New Haven neighbors.  
Our church life is centered around Sunday worship in Yale’s historic Battell Chapel, which features beautiful music, thoughtful preaching, and the prayer of a diverse, faithful community. Outside of Sunday mornings, we have lots of fun together with retreats, study groups, meals, concerts, lectures and other events. 
UCY is an open and affirming congregation; we welcome persons of any denominational background (or none), race, ethnicity, age, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, or physical or mental ability. Whether you are a life-long Christian, a questioning Christian, or new to Christianity, we hope that you feel at home with us.
goals: God calls us together to be an ecumenical Christian community in the midst of Yale University, extending an authentic and inclusive welcome to all Yale students, faculty, staff, and alumni, and all of the New Haven community.   We are called to worship the Triune God with joy and in beauty, to bring together lived faith, moral perspective and critical thought, and to serve our neighbors in the New Haven area and around the world.   As we remind ourselves each week, we are being formed by the Gospel of Jesus Christ into leaders and disciples who will do justice, love kindness, and walk humbly with God.

name: University Church in Yale Graduate Student Deacons
mission: We, the graduate deacons of the University Church in Yale, are committed to being an open Christian group that is welcoming to all people: graduate students of any denominational background (or none), race, ethnicity, age, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, or physical or mental ability are welcome. We strive to serve as leaders of the graduate members of the University Church, provide worship, social, study and service opportunities open to all graduate students, act as the “eyes and ears” of the University Church on campus, and collaborate with other religious groups.

name: Yale Club Women's Rugby Team
mission: We are the Yale Women's Rugby Football Club! We come from all walks of life, and all joined rugby with varying experience (majority had never played) but eager to meet new people, and learn a new sport with fitness-minded people. We like to say that we are the fittest team on campus :)
benefits: We are a club sport, but get a lot of perks too. We have two amazing coaches, Craig Wilson and Alycia Washington that have exponential amount of experience. We get to workout in the weight room, and also get some cool gear.

name: University Church in Yale Undergraduate Deacons
mission: We, the undergraduate deacons of the University Church in Yale, are committed to being an open Christian group that is welcoming to all people: undergraduate students of any denominational background (or none), race, ethnicity, age, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, or physical or mental ability are welcome.  We strive to serve as leaders of the undergraduate members of the University Church, provide worship, social, study and service opportunities open to all undergraduate students, act as the “eyes and ears” of the University Church on campus, and collaborate with other religious groups.

name: University Curlers at Yale - Graduate Student Division
mission: We are a group of students who play the Olympic sport of curling. Our mission is to spread interest, knowledge, and participation in the sport to help the sport grow as a whole as well as to succeed at the National Curling Competition and develop friendships.

name: URBAN Environment SIG
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups

name: Urban Improvement Corps
mission: The mission of the UIC is to spark intellectual growth amongst urban youth. Through tutoring and entrepreneurship classes, the program seeks to assist students in achieving academic success, and to inspire inner-city students to succeed beyond the classroom and in the business world.
goals: For the Fall 2020 semester, our primary goal is to continuing tutoring and mentorship while being virtual.

name: Urban Learning Community
mission: We examine the impacts of an ‘urbanized’ world, from effects on resources and biodiversity to public health and climate change.

name: Urban Resources Initiative
mission: Our mission is to foster community-based land stewardship, promote environmental education, advance the practice of urban forestry, and provide Yale students with clinical learning opportunities.

name: User Experience Society
mission: User Experience Society empowers Yale undergraduates through design education, enlightens them to the power of design, and nurtures them to create meaningful products for the community. We're nurturing human-centric design and engineering leaders for impact.

name: VARSITY Baking Club
mission: The mission of the VARSITY Baking Club is to inspire and facilitate the sharing of recipes and collaboration among those who have restricted diets, to share our baked goods publicly to help reverse the stigma that exists surrounding accessible foods, and to advocate for more safe food options in the dining halls at Yale.

name: Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Interest Group
mission: Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Interest Groups (VESIG) provides students with early exposure to the specialty of vascular surgery and helps students get involved in research and training early in their medical career.

name: Vermilion Theater
mission: We are inspired to perform plays with bilingual (Mandarin and English) versions, so as to facilitate cultural conversations and build a bridge between the theater work based in these two language mediums. We also see great value in forming such a cultural club in light of the spike in anti-AAPI sentiments since the start of the pandemic. We are naming the club "Vermilion Theater" as the vermilion bird (a phoenix-like being) is a symbol of tenacity and resilience in Chinese mythology. As we learn about the possibility of safely returning to theater in a world forever changed by COVID, we hope that our organization will bring long-isolated people together, share a sense of normalcy and build a much needed community.

name: Vida Volunteer
mission:
"To promote human and animal health by bringing together the efforts of students, communities and the local healthcare systems." 
"To become leaders in the human and animal Health Promotion Movement, through service learning experiences in Central America."
goals:
1. Promote the opportunity of volunteering with Vida Volunteer to students in Yale College, the Yale Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, and the Yale School of Medicine, in particular those interested in health professions, Spanish language immersion, and cultures of Costa Rica, Nicaragua, and Guatemala.
2. Raise awareness of the lack of necessary healthcare and health services in underserved communities of Central America in the context of Yale and beyond.
3. Fundraise for student volunteer tuitions and donations to Vida Volunteer. This may include applying for funding within Yale entities and grants, partnering with local restaurants and businesses, networking with potential donors, pursuing online fundraising platforms, hosting on-campus fundraising events, and more.
4. Host Informational meetings about health professions, volunteering abroad, cultures of Central America, and the logistics for joining a Vida Volunteer trip. Meetings are held in person or through webinar.
5. Culminate in assembling a team of about twenty students to attend one (or more) of Vida Volunteer’s service learning trips during spring break and/or summer.

name: Yale Club Women's Ultimate Frisbee Team
Vietnamese Student Association
mission: To promote a strong Vietnamese cultural connection with Yale University and create a group of loving friends who share the common connection of being Vietnamese and/or loving Vietnamese culture and people.
goals:
To serve the Vietnamese community at Yale and beyond by:
1. creating a home for Vietnamese students, faculty, and staff at Yale,
2. sharing our time, talent, and resources with those in need,
3. providing a space for navigating the Vietnamese identity,
4. and sharing and celebrating the culture that unites us all.

name: Visit New Haven  - Shopping, Dining, Attractions and Things to do in Greater New Haven
address:
PO Box 1576
New Haven, CT 06506 United States
mission:
This is the official site for information, attractions and events in Greater New Haven, CT. There is something for everyone in the New Haven area. Whether you’re a resident looking to discover new parts of the region for the first time, or a first-time visitor hoping to fit the “best of” into a day, weekend, week or longer, you can’t go wrong. It’s all waiting for you. So start exploring!+Please visit the Visit New Haven Website for everything you need to know about our region!
+Follow VisitNewHaven on social media, and subscribe to our Email Newsletter to get regular updates on events and attractions!

name: Visual Law Project
mission:
The Visual Law Project (VLP) curates workshops, lecture series, and visual media that foreground the increasingly important intersections between visual content and the law. We develop visual literacy within the YLS community and train law students to deploy visual content as a tool for advocacy.
Visual and digital technologies have transformed the practice of law.  Lawyers are using videos to present evidence, closing arguments, and victim-impact statements; advocates are making viral videos to advance public education campaigns; and scholars are debating ideas in a multimedia blogosphere.  Everyone’s doing it.  But no one is really teaching it — or reflecting upon it.  We see training in visual advocacy — effectively evaluating and making arguments through videos and images — as a vital part of our legal education.
The Visual Law Project fosters a community of students invested in visual advocacy. We enable students to produce intellectually stimulating documentary films on legal issues to advance public debate. We organize an annual reading group centered on visual jurisprudence. We connect YLS students with innovative practitioners and thinkers through our speaker series. VLP operates both within and beyond the law school, and seeks to collaborate on interdisciplinary projects with graduate students in other programs.

name: Volunteers Around the World: Yale Undergraduate Chapter
mission: Volunteers Around the World (VAW) is an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) devoted to improving the standard of living for those that live in some of the most poverty-stricken communities of the world. Our focus is to provide these communities with access to medical and dental treatment, medication, nutritional security, clean water, and health education by working first hand with experienced local doctors and fundraising for medical supplies.

name: Volunteers in Pediatrics
mission: To enrich the clinical experience and create a supportive environment for pediatric patients and their families

name: Walden Peer Counseling
mission: Walden Peer Counseling is an anonymous and confidential hotline and walk-in peer counseling service staffed by Yale undergraduates. We are available to talk about anything that's on your mind.

name: Water Learning Community
mission: This LC builds knowledge of the science, policy, and management of the world's water resources, while promoting their sustainable use and equitable access.

name: West Campus Community - Student & Postdoc Committee & Fellows
category: Academic, Administrative, Arts: Visual Arts, Professional, Science/Technology
mission: To promote events and activities for the West Campus Community of Studtents, Scholars and Trainees, including those sponsored by The West Campus Student & Postdoc Committee, McDougal GSL West Campus Fellows and OCS West Campus Fellows. Yale people working or studying at West Campus are welcome to join!
benefits: Information, events, meet people, fun!

name: Westies SIG
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups

name: Whim 'n Rhythm
mission:
As of 1981, Yale’s vibrant a cappella scene featured a dozen underclassman groups of every variety. However, seven senior women felt that a key part of their musical experience was missing – a senior group. These seven seniors founded Whim n’ Rhythm as an answer to the decades-old tradition of The Whiffenpoofs. Thirty-six years later, the 13 singers of Whim n’ Rhythm represent the best and most experienced female musicians of the senior class.
Each year, Whim has continued to grow into a full-force presence on Yale’s campus and on both the national and international stages. The group tours domestically and in the greater New England area yearly, visiting locations from New York and Los Angeles to Hong Kong and Cairo, and recently founded a full-fledged Alumnae Board to help build the group’s legacy from beyond Yale’s campus. Post-commencement, the group traditionally takes a five-to-seven week World Tour, hitting nearly every continent.
Prospective singers audition in the spring of their junior year to be tapped into Whim for their senior year the following fall. Whim represents nearly every underclassman singing group, a variety of residential colleges and academic majors, and hometowns ranging from coast to coast.

name: William F. Buckley, Jr. Program
mission: The mission of the William F. Buckley, Jr. Program is to promote intellectual diversity at Yale University. We aim to expand political discourse on campus and to expose students to often-unvoiced views. We believe that ideas have consequences and that genuine intellectual diversity is essential for advancing critical inquiry and avoiding ideological complacency. Our hope is that by providing a home for a diverse collection of serious conservative thought we can provide a forum for Yale students to consider and examine a range of political philosophies to which they are rarely exposed. As such, the purpose of this program is to foster open political discussion and intellectual engagement on campus.

name: WISAYale - a Student and Postdoc Organization
mission: As WISAY (Womxn in Science at Yale), we are dedicated to promoting the interests of female, transgender, and non-binary scientists and advocating for gender equality in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM). Historically, only a small fraction of science degrees were awarded to women, but in recent decades, women’s overall participation STEM fields has steadily increased. Today, women earn half of all bachelor’s degrees in science. The involvement of women and gender minorities in advanced study and careers in STEM fields continues to grow. However, women are still underrepresented in many STEM fields and face significant challenges at the highest levels of these professions. WISAY seeks to help overcome these disparities by supporting women and gender minorities at all career levels through mentoring, networking, career development, and community building.

name: Women & Gender Minorities in CS
mission: The mission of Float is to empower, inspire, and celebrate women and other gender minorities in computer science.

name: Women Everywhere Believe
mission: WEBelieve partners with educational institutions to provide the resources necessary to develop tomorrow's women (particularly women of color) leaders while also working to combat the barriers that often stifle their leadership growth in school and the workplace.

name: Women In Chemistry
mission: The purpose of WiCh is to help foster a positive and inclusive atmosphere within the chemistry major at Yale. Our objective is to establish a network of support and a sense of community among peers in the chemistry department, with the intent to develop effective academic and professional advising resources for women and other minorities pursuing chemistry at Yale.

name: Women in Physics
mission: Women in Physics is an organization committed to the advancement and recruitment of women in physics by helping to foster an inclusive and supportive social and academic environment for women looking to pursue physics at Yale.

name: Women of Color Collective
mission: The Women of Color Collective is an affinity group for women of color and persons of color belonging to traditionally under-represented gender identities. We provide social support, mentorship, and community.

name: Women's Leadership Initiative at Yale - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: Established to empower womxn, devoted to promoting and celebrating female leadership at Yale and beyond, committed to creating an inclusive space where all are welcome, and dedicated to placing gender equity at the forefront of campus culture. The purpose of WLI is to facilitate discussion and action at Yale University towards creating opportunities for women to take leadership roles both on campus and beyond. WLI will work to help its members and the Yale community empower each other, learn about challenges and opportunities for women around the world, and highlight gender equity.
benefits:
- Exciting, extensive, diverse, and challenging work that provide great learning opportunities and create a meaningful impact.
- Many opportunities to take initiative and contribute to projects you’re passionate about, including contributing to planning, organization, and vision for the Annual Women's Empowerment Conference, the Leading Ladies Gala, speaker, workshop, and partnership events, the Women's Mentorship Network, the Womxn of Yale podcast, and more.
- Incredibly powerful and supportive community at Yale and beyond.
- Exclusive access to WLI resume book, sponsors, and opportunities.

name: Woodbridge Fellowship Applications
mission:
Established in 2005 by President Richard C. Levin, the Woodbridge Fellowship introduces recent Yale College graduates to the work and administration of Yale. The fellowship provides valuable professional experience for potential careers in higher education and non-profit organizations, particularly for recent graduates belonging to minority communities currently underrepresented in university administration. 
Fellowships are full-time paid positions in the offices of university leaders, who take active interest in fellows’ professional development. Fellows directly report to senior members of their offices and work with a variety of university staff, at all levels. Fellows most often combine day-to-day duties with responsibilities for specific projects that utilize their research abilities and other higher-level skills. Organizational and writing skills are particularly valuable, as is the ability to work well with multiple constituencies: staff of all kinds (clerical, technical, service, maintenance, managerial, and professional), faculty, alumni, and students.   
Fellows meet regularly together, including for lunchtime conversation with the president, provost,  secretary, and other university leaders. These conversations about roles and responsibilities, and the career paths that led people into academic administration, give fellows a broad understanding of many facets of working in higher education.

name: Woodworking SIG
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups
address: New Haven, CT  United States
mission: To facilitate lifelong, fulfilling connections between students and forests by providing space for students to explore working with wood. To build community across all degree programs, class years, and academic interests, as well as with artisans in the broader New Haven community, connecting all of these groups more closely with each other and with trees and forests.
goals:
1. Help students to build safe and effective skills in carving, carpentry, and other woodworking disciplines
2. Host speakers and demonstrations for student enrichment
3. Undertake woodworking projects that engage with and benefit the broader YSE, Yale, and New Haven communities.

name: WORD: Performance Poetry
mission: WORD is Yale’s oldest and hypest spoken word group. We are a community of writers dedicated to sharing performance poetry with the Yale community, New Haven, and beyond. We organize performances on campus, conduct workshops with K-12 schools, and create collaborative art with other student groups. As a resident group of the Afro-American Cultural Center at Yale, we recognize the Black legacies that gave rise to spoken word and aim to extend those legacies to upcoming writers of all backgrounds during their four years at Yale.

name: Writers Workshop
mission: To foster the creative writing juices of interested students and share their original work for avid appreciation and helpful critique.

name: Y Fashion House
mission: Y Fashion House is the only place for fashion at Yale. We aim to be the primary point of interaction between Yale creatives and the fashion world. Y Fashion House will be an incubator of creation, an avenue through which students who show interest in fashion and design can work collaboratively in creating works of art in the form of clothes, shows, and other organizational events. We aim to foster an environment where students of various backgrounds, regardless of experience, can join peers in the common pursuit of promoting fashion and design.

name: Y Pop-UP
mission: We aim to help our members discover new cooking techniques, connect with other students interested in food, and promote cuisines and food cultures that are healthy and sustainable for individuals and the planet. We operate a full service, student run pop-up restaurant every other Friday open to Yale students, parents, friends, and professors.

name: Y-BioIncubator: A Student Collaborative
mission: Y-Bio hopes to unite the Yale-connected undergraduate, graduate, and professional engineering communities by providing a space for those interested in pursuing biological innovation in the health and medical fields. We want to give biological innovation a prominent stake on this campus. We will provide professional development workshops for these students, weekly lectures to expand their knowledge of current bio-innovations, plan trips to local biotech/medtech companies, and collaborate with CBIT/Tsai CITY to bring more medical technology creation resources to undergraduates. Lastly, we will provide students the opportunity to be involved in year-long medical device/global health technology projects, focused on mechanical devices, that will be vetted with CEID staff and CBIT.

name: Y2Y New Haven
mission: Y2Y New Haven's mission is to employ a youth-to-youth model to provide a safe and affirming environment for young adults experiencing homelessness.

name: Yale Aerospace Medicine Student and Resident Organization
mission:
We are Yale's chapter of AMSRO, the Aerospace Medicine Student and Resident Organization. AMSRO is part of the larger Aerospace Medicine Association (AsMA), which is the world's largest organization dedicated to aerospace medicine. We invite all Yale medical students to join us. We offer valuable networking opportunities through our speaker series, journal club, access to national membership benefits, scholarships, conference participation, finding aerospace medicine research opportunities, and connecting with AMSRO and AsMA members across the world. Whether you're an aspiring spaceflight surgeon or completely new to this fun specialty, this group has something to offer to everyone.
NOTE: Due to administrative constraints, participation in this group is limited to medical students; residents will not be able to join.

name: Yale Affiliates Belly Dance Society
mission: GROUP DEACTIVATED 7-2020. Contact McDougal GSL to inquire about reactivating this group. The mission of the YBDS is to provide students the opportunity to learn and create together, and explore new kinds of dances and culture. We also makes our mission to put together one big show during the spring to raise money for the Downtown Evening Soup Kitchen.

name: Yale African Graduate & Professional Students
mission: To build community among Black African graduate & professional students, post-docs, world fellows and alumni; to welcome the Black Diaspora into the fold of the African community; and provide mentorship to African undergraduates.

name: Yale African Students Association
mission: The Yale African Students Association (YASA) is an undergraduate student organisation at Yale University, registered with the Yale College Dean’s Office (YCDO). YASA is an organisation established to convene a community of African students, both graduate and undergraduate, on Yale’s campus, to discuss and raise awareness of pertinent issues on the continent, and to attend to the specific needs and interests of African students at Yale.
goals: To serve the needs of the community of African undergraduates on Yale's campus.

name: Yale Albanian Student Society
mission: The Yale Albanian Student Society hopes to bring together students interested in aspects of Albanian culture. We also hope to strengthen the Albanian community at Yale.

name: Yale Club Women's Water Polo Team
Yale Alternative Investments - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: YAI focuses on providing members experience in alternative investing: private equity, venture capital, real estate, and hedge funds. Through working on projects with established funds, members are given student internships, acquiring valuable hands-on financial experience while gaining insight into the mechanics of alternative investing.  Beyond project-based learning, YAI seeks to pursue deeper into the alternative investment space by inviting guest speakers and providing exclusive opportunities to network with industry professionals.  As Yale's first and only finance organization centered solely on alternative investing, YAI offers an unparalleled experience to contribute to multi-million and billion dollar investments as an undergraduate.
goals:
- Complete projects for industry leading firms across alternative investment types, including Private Equity, Venture Capital, and Real Estate.  In addition to working with the same hedge fund as last year, we will be expanding project offerings among other firms.
- Host guest speaker events on alternative investment for the larger Yale community.  Building upon last year's activity, we will continue to invite some of the most accomplished industry experts.
- Invite top PE and hedge funds to engage with club members for informational and recruitment purposes.  These opportunities currently do not exist at Yale.
- Organize team bonding and social events in as great a capacity as possible.  We believe that pre-professional clubs should actually exist as communities - it makes working together easier and more fun.  Becoming actual friends with each other is an important focus of the club.

name: Yale Alumni Association (YAA) Activities - for Continuing and Graduating Yale Students
address:
PO Box 209010
New Haven, CT 6520-9010 United States
mission: Yale Alumni Association is eager to encourage communication and connection among Yale graduates through online resources, clubs and events in person and virtually around the world. Yale Alumni Association hopes to provide a lifetime of valuable ways to stay connected to Yale and creates special events to connect current and soon-to-graduate students and alumni for networking and career development.

name: Yale Alumni Club of New Haven - Current Yale Students can join for Local Alumni Networking & Events
address:
Yale Club of New HavenPost Office Box #775
New Haven, CT 06503-0775 United States
mission: The Yale Club of New Haven is the official alumni group for all alumni and current students in Greater New Haven. If you are a current student, a soon to graduate or recent graduate, join the YCNH to meet and network with alumni, attend social events and activities and get to know your hometown Yale Alumni group. The Yale Club of New Haven welcomes alumni, current students, faculty, staff, and friends to become members. Graduate Student membership is FREE!

name: Yale Animal Law Society
mission: The Yale Animal Law Society, a member of the Student Animal Legal Defense Fund, works to reduce animal suffering by providing resources and events related to animal law to the law school community. We welcome all who are interested in developing legal, policy, and community-based strategies to protect animals.

name: Yale Animal Welfare Alliance - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: YAWA focuses on raising awareness, sparking conversation, and fostering a progressive community of students committed to confronting cruelty and effecting meaningful social change for animals.
goals:
Yale Animal Welfare Alliance aims to improve conditions for animals worldwide by raising
awareness, sparking conversation, and fostering a progressive, cruelty-free student community.  We aim to create change from the grassroots level up, engaging the student community in
raising awareness, advocating for reform, and providing resources for the community to begin
making change themselves.

name: Yale Anti-Gravity Society - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The Yale Anti-Gravity Society aims to bring together jugglers and people with other circus-related talents of all skill levels so that we may learn from one another and grow as entertainers and performers. Juggling along with other circus arts is intrinsically a group activity, and we aim to create a supportive space where anyone with any interest in such activities can share their passion with other like-minded individuals and possibly collaborate on performances.

name: Yale Armenian Network: an Undergraduate Organization
mission: The Yale Armenian Network is an undergraduate student association that fosters and promotes Armenian culture and heritage to the Yale community. Furthermore, the Armenian Students’ Association shall raise efforts to promote positive social interactions among Armenian students at Yale.

name: Yale Art History Group - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: The club aims to supports art history education by promoting discussions on art and society throughout history and across cultures
goals: Host events that invite artists and speakers to talk about art and its influence. Embark on projects that promote art history and its connection to other areas of society. Host activities such as field trips to museums and landmarks to inspire art appreciation. Lead discussions that deepen students' understanding of art and society. Conduct workshops that develop students' critical and visual thinking

name: Yale ArtsConnect - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale ArtsConnect serves to create a space for local and regional artists to be able to engage with the New Haven & Yale community and its students through productive and thoughtful discussion, communication and collaboration. By hosting interactive talks, arts-based education classes, social media engagement and more, the YAC strives to shine local art and its artists in an appropriate and representative manner.

name: Yale Athletics - Student Promotions
address:
20 Tower Parkway
New Haven, Conn 06511 United States
mission: The Official Page for \

name: Yale Ballroom Dance Team and Club
mission: YBDT focuses on providing an encouraging and accepting environment for everyone. We organize practices and lessons, taught by veteran team members and professional instructors, catered to all skill levels from newcomers to champions. Everyone is welcomed and no prior dance experience is required! Members have the opportunity to participate in competitions and showcases each semester.

name: Yale Biomedical Engineering Student Society
mission: The Yale Chapter of the Biomedical Engineering Society aims to increase awareness of the possibilities available through biomedical engineering, an interdisciplinary field in which the principles of basic science and engineering are applied to medicine. We hope to provide students at Yale with access to applied biomedical engineering in both academia and industry. We serve as a support network and forum for all biomedical engineering students to ask advice or express their concerns in hopes of creating a strong, integrated major.
goals: The goals of the Yale Chapter of the Biomedical Engineering Society for 2020-2021 focus on increasing connections among BME students as well as providing resources to build their skill sets to launch them towards their dream internships at Yale and careers beyond Yale. Yale BMEs will host weekly webinars and tutorials that engage students in practicing engineering and design as well as recruit industry and research professionals to give talks about their careers and the possibilities that a BME degree allows for. Additionally, Yale BMES plans to host virtual designathons and hackathons to challenge teams of students to think outside the box and apply the knowledge they have gained from courses, life, and the society's webinars. This will be a year of growth and connections for BME students at Yale.

name: Yale Biotech Club - For Students & Affiliates
Yale Black Law Students' Association
mission: The Yale Black Law Students Association (BLSA) is a student organization composed of Yale Law School students concerned with issues affecting members of the African Diaspora. The purpose of BLSA is to support and advance the interests of its members and the broader Black community.

name: Yale Black Postdoctoral Association (YBPA)
mission:
The Yale School of Medicine Black Postdoctoral Association (YBPA) addresses the unmet needs of Black postdocs and focuses on the success and well-being of Black postdocs by taking the necessary steps to generate positive experiences in academia and elsewhere.
The organization works harmoniously with the Yale Postdoctoral Association (YPA); however, extends its objectives to address issues specific to Black postdocs that are often overlooked, such as representation and visibility, resource availability and opportunities for career development, sense of community and support, and retention.
goals:
1. Create a community for Black postdocs and allies across Yale campus
2. Increase Visibility of talented Black Postdocs
3. Professional mentorship and professional development
4. Outreach to underserved communities

name: Yale Black Seminarians
mission: Yale Black Seminarians is a faith-based, student-led organization committed to enhancing the lives of black students at Yale Divinity School. The mission of the Yale Black Seminarians serves the entire Yale Divinity School community with a committed focus on mobilizing the presence of black students through advocacy, faith and the pursuit of justice. Activities have included the Fall Revival, the Martin Luther King Day Worship Service, the Angel Tree Project at Christmas, and the Parks-King Lecture in the Spring. As an integral part of the YDS Community, the Yale Black Seminarians remain committed to diversity among both students and faculty.

name: Yale Black Women's Coalition - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The mission of Yale Black Women’s Coalition is to provide an ever-evolving, safe, and welcoming space to unite Black women and nonbinary folx in the Yale community. The coalition strives to be a community-led space that is inclusive of and elevates  marginalized groups within our community with the recognition of intersectional identities.
goals:
To counter the patriarchy and build spaces for those who are directly marginalized and silenced by it 
To create a tight-knit community where all those who want to be part of and engaged in the community have access to it
To address problems both facing and inside the black community 
To create lasting bonds and connections across college and university levels

name: Yale Breakers (Cerebral Adikts) - An Undergraduate Organization
mission:
The mission for the organization is to teach and practice the art of breakdancing and to help promote Hip Hop culture. Members are given the opportunity to independently pursue their self-expression through the dance, engage with other dancers, and to develop their abilities.
In addition to teaching breakdance culture, we hope to take our group to several competitions in the East Coast including Battle for Boston and BreaksU to give students battle experience.
We are open to welcoming breakers of all skill levels! Whether you're totally new to the scene or here for a while, we'd love to dance and train with you. We are also open to both undergrads and graduate students.

name: Yale Cancer Student Interest Group
mission: The Cancer Student Interest Group (CSIG) works closely with the Yale Cancer Center to expose students to oncology and the oncological subspecialties. We coordinate events that seek to connect students with ongoing research, faculty mentors, and shadowing opportunities.

name: Yale Caribbean Students' Organization
mission: The Yale Caribbean Students’ Organization (CSO) aims to create a space on Yale’s campus for the celebration of the rich and diverse cultures of the Caribbean region and its many diasporas.

name: Yale Center for Asylum Medicine
mission: The Yale Center for Asylum Medicine conducts forensic medical interviews and evaluations for asylum-seekers referred to Yale by regional legal groups and community organizations.

name: Yale Center for British Art
benefits:
If you are interested in joining our free membership program, please register online or contact our Advancement and External Affairs department at ycba.advancement@yale.edu | +1 203 432 8559.
As a free member of the Center, you are automatically subscribed to our weekly enewsletter, which includes information about special programs, events, and activities. Members receive a 20 percent discount on the Center’s publications and select promotions in the Museum Shop, as well as prorated parking in the Chapel-York Street Garage. Membership also provides access to the College and University Art Museums Reciprocal Program, including eighty museums across the country.

name: Yale Center for Business and the Environment
mission: To educate and inspire interdisciplinary leaders through business solutions to systemic environmental problems.
goals:
Our vision is to build a purpose-driven community that collaborates in diverse networks in order to:
-CBEYond boundaries, disciplines and challenges and move toward sustainable solutions
-CBEYond current business models by catalyzing innovation and entrepreneurship
-CBEYond traditional financial markets by growing sustainable investment
-CBEYond the degree into active learning communities and vibrant alumni networks

name: Yale Center for Environmental Law and Policy
Yale CHAARG - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale CHAARG is an inclusive health + wellness organization based on college campuses to encourage everyone + anyone to find their fit through a community of supportive + empowering women + allies. We sweat together twice a week through weekly workouts with fitness instructors and small groups with bonding activities. Our socials throughout the semester also allow us to build relationships with other members.

name: Yale Children's Theater - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The mission of Yale's Children's Theater is to share the joy of theater with Yalies and the youth of New Haven.

name: Yale Cinematic Productions - A Student Alliance
Yale Civil Rights Project
mission: The Yale Civil Rights Project is an organization for students working collaboratively with non-profit organizations such as the ACLU, Know Your IX, and National Employment Law Project on legal research projects related to civil rights in the areas of civil liberties, critical race theory, economic justice, LGBTQ rights, racial justice, and women's rights.

name: Yale Club Cycling Team
mission: To develop competitive and ethical racers, enthusiasm for riding, equality in racing, and foster a local biking community.

name: Yale Club Equestrian Team
mission: The purpose of this team is to provide the opportunity for Yale students to compete in IHSA horse shows and to learn about equitation and horsemanship in a safe and supportive team environment.

name: Yale Club Indoor Climbing Team
mission: YCT's mission is to provide a community for climbers at Yale and to provide resources for competition climbers at Yale. We welcome all students, regardless of prior experience, to join our team.

name: Yale Club Kendo Team
mission: Yale Kendo seeks to teach the practice of Kendo in the Yale Community. Kendo (the way of the sword) is a martial art based on traditional Japanese swordmanship.
goals: To practice the martial art of kendo, and thereby strengthen both body and mind.

name: Yale College Democrats
mission: The Yale College Democrats are intentional advocates for progressive change in New Haven, in Connecticut, and across the country. We fight for candidates and causes that advance equal justice, human dignity, and the empowerment of all people. We embrace students of all backgrounds who want to take action and join a diverse community of dedicated progressives.

name: Yale Club Men's Soccer (C-2) Team
mission: Our mission is to play the beautiful game beautifully while building a team whose chemistry transcends the boundaries of a soccer field.
benefits: C2 plays in an outdoor Intramural League, competing with colleges and universities in the region. We usually play 10 full-sided games in the Fall, and then compete in a local CT indoor league in the Winter. We practice roughly two times a week, moving indoors once the days get shorter in the Fall.  C2 also spends time together off the field, with social hangouts, meals, and viewings of pro soccer games. C2 has a strong alumni network who come back to campus in the Spring for our Alumni Game. Once a C2 boy, always a C2 boy.
goals: Win, have fun, repeat.

name: Yale Club Men's Ultimate Frisbee Team - Süperfly
mission: We are a sports team that exists to teach the sport of ultimate at a high level to all of our players, no matter what their athletic/ultimate backgrounds. Additionally, we strive to succeed competitively while staying true to the values of the international ultimate community that include gender equity and spirit of the game.

name: Yale Club Men's Water Polo Team
Yale Club Muay Thai Kickboxing Team
mission: The Muay Thai Kickboxing Club aims to provide a community where Yale undergraduate and graduate students can safely learn the Muay Thai style of martial arts for recreational and self-defense purposes.

name: Yale Club Running Team
mission:
Yale Club Running welcomes all undergraduates (and graduate students) to run with us as a group. We offer multiple pace groups every day, and are far more focused on running together than running "fast." We do not hold try-outs, we do conduct organized -- and completely optional, occasionally overnight -- trips to cross country meets in the fall and track and marathon events in the spring. Track and other running workouts are held twice a week, but like all YCR events, workouts are totally optional. Alternate runs will always be available on workout days.
We're a friendly group, with a wide array of Yale experiences and backgrounds.
Join us to see Yale and New Haven in a new way!
goals:
- To run as a group
- To train for races (2020 fall races canceled) and a marathon in the spring
- To explore New Haven in all directions from Yale
- To have fun!

name: Yale Club Skiing (Alpine) Team
goals: to be siiiiiiick

name: Yale Club Swim Team
mission:
Yale Club Swimming is a team of students from all corners of
campus life, with any range of experience, who come together due
to their love of swimming and the close-knit, family environment
that they find.
goals:
This year our organization hopes to offer a place of support and
community for members of the Yale Undergraduate class who
share a love of swimming. We are planning a multitude of socially
distanced team bonding events to keep the bonds within our swim
community strong, and forge new ones with the incoming class of
2024!

name: Yale Club Synchronized Swimming Team
mission: Our goal is to provide a space where people of all experience levels can join and learn how to synchronized swim and to also create a fun and supportive community.

name: Yale Club Tae Kwon Do Team
Yale Club Triathlon Team
mission: We are an all-inclusive group of undergraduate and graduate students who enjoy the sport of triathlon. We strive to create an environment where athletes of all skill levels can receive professional coaching and training in the sport they love. We also work hard to make an otherwise very expensive and elite sport affordable and accessible to students. Join us for fun swim/bike/run practices - no previous experience needed!
benefits: Access to practices in the pool and spin room, guidance from a professional triathlon coach, race opportunities, insider knowledge on local running/cycling/open water swim routes.
goals: Our goal as the Yale Club Triathlon Team is to train together in a fun and inclusive environment. We hold around six optional practices each week and compete in both sprint and Olympic distance triathlons as well as other races.

name: Yale Club Wushu and Chinese Kung-fu Team
category: Cultural, Performance: Other, AACC Affiliate Org
mission:
The Yale Wushu team seeks to better its members in practice; by gaining focus and self-control
through intense training. Members hope to achieve self-mastery that will translate into respect
and compassion for others both inside and outside of the training hall.
Yale Wushu also seeks to better its community. The Yale Wushu team has been blessed by
many opportunities to spread the message of peace and nonviolence that lies at the center of
the word “wushu.” Our classmates at Yale will go on to be leaders in their respective fields; it is
our hope that during our time here we succeed in spreading this message of peace to them. We
are also trying to spread this message to the city of New Haven.

name: Yale College - Council of Heads of College
Yale College Anime Society
mission: The purpose of the Yale College Anime Society is to allow people to appreciate East Asian culture--especially Japanese culture--through the lens of media and entertainment. We hope to give people the opportunity to explore genres and mediums they may have never explored. We primarily hope to do this through exposure to, discussion of, and analysis of Japanese Animation and Comics (i.e. "anime" and "manga"), Japanese music, and Japanese culture in general but will also look at manhwas, webtoons, light novels, and a variety of other mediums and genres . Through this, we aim to broaden the overall appeal and awareness of Eastern Asian media and entertainment, such as anime and manga, and increase the presence of this unique art form in the mainstream consciousness.
goals: We hope to give people the opportunity to explore genres and mediums they may not have previously experienced through exposure to and discussion/analysis of Japanese Animation and Comics (i.e. "anime" and "manga"), Japanese music, and Japanese culture in general. Occasionally we will also discuss manhwas, webtoons, light novels, and a variety of other mediums and genres. Through this, we aim to broaden the overall appeal and awareness of Eastern Asian media and entertainment, such as anime and manga, and increase the presence of this unique art form in the mainstream consciousness.

name: Yale College Black Men's Student Union
mission: The BMU's mission is to uplift and empower Black men on and off Yale's campus through our tenets of unity, support and service.

name: Yale College Bridge Club
mission:
Bridge: It’s not your grandmother’s card game.
             Well, actually, it may very well be your grandmother’s card game. Still, bridge is a fun and challenging game for all ages with depth rivaling that of chess, go, and other popular pastimes. In addition, as a partnership game, bridge is also social—a fun activity for friends and a great way to meet new people. Bridge can be learned by middle schoolers, but remains challenging for 40 year veterans of the game.
             The Yale College Bridge Club exists to introduce new players to the game and support the game on campus and in the community. Our weekly games are informal and open to beginners and experts alike. If you’re fond of puzzles, math, or other games, have family or friends who play, or are just looking for an interesting hobby, come check us out!

name: Yale College Chess Club
mission: We exist to promote and facilitate the game of chess within the Yale-New Haven community, and to represent Yale in intercollegiate chess tournaments.

name: Yale College Class of 2024
mission: This portal will be your guide through the months ahead as you prepare to join us on campus. On here you will find important forms, deadlines, and tons of information about what life at Yale is like.

name: Yale College Class of 2025
mission: This portal will be your guide through the months ahead as you prepare to join us on campus. On here you will find important forms, deadlines, and tons of information about what life at Yale is like.

name: Yale College Council
mission: The purpose of YCC shall be to pursue the improvement of the Yale undergraduate experience by lending a voice to student concerns and opinions, shaping University policy, protecting student rights and freedoms, promoting and financing undergraduate organizations, fostering school unity and pride, and serving as a forum for the discussion and advancement of student ideas. We shall serve as the primary liaison between the undergraduate student body and the administration, graduate schools, faculty, staff, alumni, and persons or groups outside of the University. Any issue affecting the quality of undergraduate life or education falls within the jurisdiction of YCC.
goals:
1) Advocate for policy change within the college 2) Organize and sponsor student events & 3) Provide grassroots student services.
By way of these actions, we lend a voice to student concerns and opinions; protect student rights and freedoms; foster school unity and pride; and serve as a forum for the discussion and advancement of student ideas.

name: Yale College Dean's Office Student Affairs
mission: The Office of Student Affairs, located on the 2nd floor of 55 Whitney Avenue, provides critical support, advocacy, information, and guidance to undergraduates. Students are encouraged to seek the assistance of our office whenever needed.

name: Yale College Republicans
mission: To make known and promote the principles of the Republican Party among the students at Yale University, to recruit Yale students as members of this organization and as members of the Republican Party, to aid in the election of Republican candidates at all levels of government, and to develop political awareness and leadership abilities among Republican students as preparation for future service to the party.

name: Yale College Student Organization Officers
address:
55 Whitney, Suite 240
New Haven, CT 06511 United States
mission: Yale College recognizes that organizations under the leadership of undergraduates can and do enhance a student’s education by providing additional opportunities beyond the curriculum for personal development and growth. The Office of Student Affairs assists students in developing organizations and planning events, sometimes providing financial advice and assistance, clarifying University policies and procedures, and authorizing the use of University resources and facilities.

name: Yale Computer Society: Students Promoting Computer Science and Engineering at Yale
mission: We're Yale's tech community. Yale Computer Society exists to enrich the campus experience of tech and entrepreneurship by inspiring, informing, and engaging Yale students regarding these topics.

name: Yale Danceworks - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Danceworks is committed to spreading the love of dance to everyone, catering to all styles and levels of experience, and giving everyone an opportunity to learn, improve, and perform!

name: Yale Debate Association - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: As Yale's only competitive intercollegiate debating organization, we compete in the American Parliamentary style of debate as a member of the American Parliamentary Debate Association (APDA) and in the British Parliamentary style as a member of the US Universities Debating Association (USUDA). We represent Yale both across the country and around the world.
goals:
- Maintain College of the Year ranking on the American Parliamentary Debate Association (APDA)
- Accumulate individual awards on APDA
- Accumulate individual awards in British Parliamentary (BP) debate, including at the World Championship
- Run successful tournaments
- Strong recruitment and high retention among team members

name: Yale Depolarization Initiative – an Undergraduate Organization
mission: To uncover and understand the sources and mechanisms of polarization and to counteract them through innovative technological applications, thoughtful exposition, and productive collaboration within the Yale community.

name: Yale Dominican Student Association
mission:
DSA was founded with the intent of spreading awareness concerning the Dominican experience and culture. These goals shall be met through:
(a) Sponsoring informative and social events that will aid in addressing issues concerning Dominicans and other Latinos. These events shall be open to the entire Yale and New Haven community.
(b) Concentrating its efforts on recruitment and retention of Dominican students by developing academic and personal support networks for undergraduate students, and establishing networks with professionals and DSA alumni.
(c) Striving to serve Dominican communities in the United States and abroad through community service.
(d) Obtaining historical and updated information about the Dominican Republic, in order to serve as a resource to the Yale community on Dominican affairs.

name: Yale Drama Coalition: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: In order to foster communication and collaboration within the undergraduate theater community and provide resources to students who wish to enhance their theatrical experience, the Yale Drama Coalition (YDC) is dedicated to acting as an organizational body in support of the performance community at Yale. We seek to both offer support for individual productions and also advocate on behalf of the theater community before the Yale administration.
goals:
The YDC’s core goals include:
-Facilitating access into the sphere of undergraduate theater, 
-Strengthening a sense of community among theatermakers, and 
-Promoting fairness and openness within that community.

name: Yale Ecology and Evolutionary Biology Undergraduate Group
mission: The Yale Ecology and Evolutionary Biology Undergraduate Group (YEEBUG) is a student organization committed to furthering educational, social, and community service opportunities for undergraduates interested in ecology and evolutionary biology. Open to all Yale undergraduates, YEEBUG will function to increase interaction among students outside the classroom and to encourage meaningful connections with faculty members in the natural sciences. Through field trips, study group meetings, forums, workshops, guest lectures, and special student-faculty dinners, YEEBUG will foster a community and make widely available the resources of Yale's Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology. YEEBUG also will actively promote student involvement in biology-related activities that serve the local community. YEEBUG will encourage members to volunteer together at educational events held at the Peabody Museum of Natural History in New Haven.

name: Yale Genetics Club
mission: Yale Genetics Club is dedicated to students interested in expanding their genetics-related research opportunities and outreach. We are committed to connecting students with Yale's genetics resources, discussing emerging research in a journal club format, and increasing genetics-related exposure to the Yale undergraduate and greater New Haven community.

name: Yale Student Branch of the IEEE
mission: Y-IEEE's mission is to promote Electrical Engineering at the intersection of liberal arts and technology via exciting projects and inspiring events. We envision a vibrant, spontaneous, and ambitious culture of engineering at Yale.

name: Yale Economic Review: A Yale College Student Publication
mission:
The Yale Economic Review is a platform for discussion, opinion, and excellent undergraduate writing on economic topics.
As such, the YER is dedicated to sharing insights from Yale students and other community members on recent and important developments in economics to a sophisticated yet broad audience. The YER seeks to unite students and faculty in furthering the goals of Yale University, and in strengthening Yale’s reputation as one of the world's leading academic institutions in the fields of economics, policy, and finance.
Finally, the YER is committed to providing members with a diverse community of fellow economics, policy and finance enthusiasts, with exposure to the top economic minds in business and politics through speaker series and workshops, and with a variety of career, writing, and other support resources.
benefits: Priority publication, regular updates from the YER, access to interviews/ workshops with industry leaders, alumni at top firms and professors

name: Yale Effective Altruism Student Group
mission: To spread the ideas of effective altruism through analysis, outreach, advocacy, education and collaboration, and to engage with and enable effective altruistic practice using the immense resources and opportunities available at Yale. We aim to help facilitate students to find effective charities and enter careers that do a significant amount of good.
goals:
The purpose of this organization is to use evidence and reason to do the most good, by:
a. Promoting the key concepts of Effective Altruism
b. Encouraging students to use EA ideas to inform career decisions
c. Connecting students to high impact opportunities, connections, and resources
d. Encouraging the Yale community to donate more
e. Encouraging the Yale community to donate more effectively

name: Yale Entrepreneurial Society – an Undergraduate Organization
category: Academic, Entrepreneurial/Business, Leadership, Media/Technology, Pre-Professional, Social
mission: The Yale Entrepreneurial Society is an undergraduate organization that aims to cultivate a cohesive and supportive community of entrepreneurs by showcasing, connecting, and aiding students interested in the entrepreneurial scene at Yale and beyond.
goals: We’re training the next generation of Bulldog entrepreneurs. Our goal is to give you the foundation to immerse yourself in entrepreneurship, form lasting connections, and build great ideas.

name: Yale Ethiopian and Eritrean Students Association
mission: Provide a space that brings together the Ethiopian and Eritrean community including the diaspora community at Yale to celebrate our shared culture, history and language and engage in conversations of social, political and economic issues affecting our countries.

name: Yale First-Gen and/or Low-income Advocacy Movement (YFAM)
mission: We are a coalition dedicated to advocacy and community-building for all First-gen and/or low-income students at Yale. Throughout the year, we form task forces based on the projects that members want to work on, such as FGLI student-faculty mixers, financial aid literacy, and advocating for a FGLI-dedicated space on campus. In the midst of all of this advocacy, we also make sure to foster a safe space for FGLI folks to bond and form deeper relationships - if we don't support each other, who will?
benefits:
- mentorship
- making new friends within the FGLI community
- building leadership skills
- opportunities to take on projects that make real, impactful changes
goals: FGLI bonding and expanding resources for our community

name: Yale Folk Music Collective - A Student Organization
mission: The Yale Folk Music Collective serves the Yale community as an inclusive space for people who enjoy listening, playing, dancing, and meeting others who love folk music of all abilities. We strive to create a community of students and musicians from New Haven (and beyond!) through jams, listening parties, workshops, and dances.

name: Yale Francophone Student Organization
mission: The Yale Francophone Association unites French-speaking students to create a closer-knit Francophone community at Yale. We aim to provide a space for students to converse in French, socialize, and share diverse cultures and culinary traditions. The Yale Francophone Association seeks to celebrate and foster an appreciation for Francophone cultures on campus.

name: Yale French Club - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The Yale French Club (- An Undergraduate Organization) intends to provide a space on campus for students to practice French outside the classroom in a fun and exciting way. Our events aim to promote a greater knowledge and appreciate of the French language and culture. We hope to connect French language learners with various skill levels in a mutual goal of enhancing their French skills.

name: Yale Friends of Israel: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale Friends of Israel seeks to bring Israeli society, culture, and politics to campus, and encourages open dialogue about Israel’s domestic and international politics. We seek to foster a community of Yale students who are passionate about Israel and the Middle East.

name: Yale Funbotics - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: Our mission is to introduce robotics to the underprivileged youth in New Haven and encourage imagination and teamwork. By providing an early, hands-on look into engineering, Funbotics aims to drive more children into STEM fields from a young age. Through our program, students not only learn the foundations of robotics and develop critical thinking, team-building, and presentation skills, but they also are exposed to the fun in robotics and STEM.
goals: For the Fall 2020 Semester, our primary goal is to create enriching content for middle schoolers while abiding by Yale's guidelines for maintaining social distancing and working with minors.

name: Yale Handbell Ensemble – A Student Group
mission: The Yale Handbell Ensemble strives to promote the performance and appreciation of handbell music at Yale University. Our primary goal is to encourage the diversification of student talent on campus and to provide undergraduates with a broader venue in which they can express themselves musically.

name: Yale Hawai'i Institute - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The purpose of this organization is to both provide a network and establish unity between Yale students from Hawai’i and to provide extra support for these students as they navigate their life far away from home.

name: Yale Helix Group: A Student Organization
mission: We aim to empower pre-health students, entrepreneurs and developers to disrupt healthcare with technology. We do so by exposing them to cutting-edge health technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning, and fostering an interdisciplinary community of innovators, industry professionals and healthcare providers.

name: Yale Hillel - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The mission of Yale Hillel is to enable and support vibrant Jewish life on campus. Through programming, leadership, and communal support, provide religious, cultural, and social opportunities for students to engage with Judaism and come together in community.

name: Yale Hindu Students Organization
mission: The Hindu Students Organization (HSO) aims to foster an environment of Hindu spirituality through an open community of religious practice and cultural expression. We organize events throughout the year to promote an awareness of Hinduism within the Yale and New Haven community. Our events are meant to stimulate an exchange of ideas on religion, and are above all, educational.
goals:
- To bring the Hindu community together to celebrate religious events and engage with each other spiritually and socially
- To promote an awareness of Hinduism in the Yale and New Haven community 
- To create an open environment where individuals feel comfortable to share and express themselves through art, prayer, service, or communication.

name: Yale Hip-Hop - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: We serve the Yale Community with extraordinary hip-hop events!

name: Yale Indoors - An Undergraduate Society
mission: The purpose of Yale Indoors is to stress the importance of remaining indoors at all costs.

name: Yale International Genetically Engineered Machine Team - An Undergraduate Organization
mission:
The Yale International Genetically Engineered Machine Team is an undergraduate-run research
organization that designs and conducts projects in synthetic biology. We seek to conduct cutting-edge, publication-quality research that is motivated by real-world problems. We also explore the impact of our research and of synthetic biology as a field through community engagement.
goals: The Yale iGEM (International Genetically Engineered Machine) team is a competitive research team which travels to France every two years to present undergraduate-led and undergraduate-organized research. We focus mainly on synthetic biology and its applications to modern problems. Our past project focused on plastic degradation via the application of PETase produced by E. Coli, and we earned a silver medal in 2018 at the iGEM Jamboree. Our current project has changed due to the COVID-19, and this past summer we have been working on two separate projects: (1) albumin, and (2) NCAAs and Crispr-Cas9.

name: Yale Interpretation Network–a Student Organization
mission: The Yale Interpretation Network (YIN) provides pro-bono interpretation and translation services to bridge the gap between Limited English Proficient community members and social services. If you are fluent in another language, please sign up here: https://www.interpretationnetwork.org/volunteer
benefits: As a member, you will have opportunities to gain valuable professional experience in law, social work, criminal justice, medicine, and more through our placement program. At the same time, you can help members of our community access the services they need without a language barrier. Time commitment is very flexible; you decide when you want to take a placement.

name: Yale Israel Public Affairs Committee: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The mission of YIPAC is to strengthen, protect and promote the U.S.-Israel relationship in ways that enhance the security of the United States and Israel and teach students valuable advocacy skills.

name: Yale Journal of Behavioral Economics - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: Our goal is to create a forum for students who are interested in learning more about Behavioral Economics. The Yale Journal of Behavioral Economics will publish two issues each year: one in the fall semester and one in the spring semester.

name: Yale Journal of Medicine and Law: An Undergraduate Publication
mission: The Yale Journal of Medicine and Law: An Undergraduate Publication is Yale’s premier publication focusing on the ever-growing crossroads between law and medicine. Since its inception in 2003, the Journal has been at the forefront of issues like healthcare policy, bioethics, healthcare economics, biomedical research, and global health care. We have featured interviews with prominent figures including US Senators, directors of organizations such as the CDC and NIH, and the US Surgeon General. Our Executive Board is comprised of students from a variety of backgrounds with foci in both medicine and law, and our Advisory Board includes prominent academicians and leaders from Yale University and beyond. Our aim is to provide our wide readership with a view of the most pressing issues and exciting advances at the intersection of medicine and law.

name: Yale Launch: Undergraduate Startup Incubator - a student organization
mission: Launch aims to identify novel solutions to both existing and future challenges, and create successful ventures based on these solutions.
goals:
To create an inclusive and supportive community of student entrepreneurs.
To generate innovative solutions to problems on a local, national and global scale.
To enrich the campus entrepreneurship ecosystem through speaker events and partnerships with other entrepreneurship groups.

name: Yale Literary Magazine: An Undergraduate Publication
mission: The Yale Literary Magazine aims to foster a literary community and celebrate the work of Yale writers and artists by publishing a semesterly magazine of student work.

name: Yale Magic Society - An Undergraduate Organization
