mission: To foster a magical community at Yale through performances and personal instruction to students of all different experience levels. To invite famous magicians from around the world to come to Yale to speak and perform. To travel to various locations across the country and the world and put on shows at public and private venues. To perform magic at schools, hospitals, and homeless shelters throughout New Haven.
goals: To bring joy and entertainment to the Yale community and the greater New Haven community through shows and performances.

name: Yale Math Competition: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale Math Competition aims to host an annual math competition that is more accessible to high school students all over America. The project is a collaboration between Yale, Columbia, University of Florida, University of Michigan and University of Virginia.

name: Yale Medical Professions Outreach - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: YMPO is an undergraduate program dedicated to broadening the horizons of Yale students interested in medicine. Members have opportunities to learn about medicine directly from professionals by shadowing physician-mentors in their work environments. Students can also learn about health-related issues through various lectures, panel discussions, and events held throughout the year. Event topics include medically-related volunteer opportunities, conversations with admissions officers from various medical schools and physicians from a wide range of specialties, and local and international outreach work. Additionally, we understand the importance of teamwork and mentorship in fostering a community of future doctors and leaders in medicine by holding an annual mentoring program that connects Yale undergraduate students with Yale medical students.

name: Yale Menus Student Organization
mission: We develop the Yale Menus app: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/yale-menus/id1273168650?mt=8.
goals: To help Yalies know what's to eat! During COVID-19, everything is different, but our fundamental goal remains the same.

name: Yale Mexican Student Organization
mission: The Yale Mexican Student Organization aims to foster a community of those with an affiliation to Mexico. The organization seeks to promote connectivity among members, kindle an awareness of Mexico and celebrate its culture, and to fortify the relationship between Mexico and Yale. To advance this mission, it works to organize social and cultural events, discussion forums, and community service – it strives to generally provide a space to share and expand Mexican experiences and perspectives at Yale and beyond. ¡Viva Mexico!

name: Yale Model Congress (Undergraduate)
mission: Since 1993, Yale Model Congress has devoted itself to staging conferences that provide our high school delegates with the opportunity to assume the responsibilities of our elected representatives and to tackle the issues that face our nation. We strive to provide delegates with an engaging, fulfilling, and intimate environment in which to fight for their legislation, debate their opinions, and deepen their understanding of how our government works. By the end of four days together, we hope that all delegates leave with a greater appreciation for the nature of American democracy and with the inspiration to be active citizens in the future.

name: Yale Movement
category: Cultural, Performance: Dance, AACC Affiliate Org
mission: Yale Movement is a performance organization that promotes consciousness of the origins of K-pop while recognizing the history of Urban dance. We provide a fun, supportive, and constructive outlet to Yale students and the greater New Haven community. We hope to learn, grow, and create as a team and present high-quality performances.
goals:
Learn, create and teach choreographies under K-pop and Urban dance.
Create an online presence through an interactive website and a social media presence.
Maintain and foster a community around K-pop and Urban dance.

name: Yale Muslim Students Association
category: Cultural, Religious/Spiritual, AACC Affiliate Org, AfAm Affiliate Org, NACC Affiliate Org, Cultural: Mixed Race
mission: The Muslim Students Association (MSA) provides Yale students with the opportunity to come together in a supportive Muslim environment and seeks to educate the Yale and New Haven communities about Islam. All students and community members are welcome to MSA activities and events. Above all, we recognize that students are at varied levels in their own faith and we are welcoming to all, regardless of the extent of one's religious knowledge or determination.
goals: Our goal is to provide a space that serves the needs of the Muslim Community at Yale University spiritually, politically, and socially. We also strive to serve the New Haven community through initiatives like Breaking Bread and Barriers in which we provide food and supplies for the homeless community around Yale's campus.

name: Yale Neuroscience Education Undergraduate Research Organization
mission: YNEURO is a student group that aims to foster the undergraduate neuroscience community at Yale. We host events (panels, research talks, bluebooking, etc.), coordinate mentorship pairs, and create opportunities for students to become more involved in neuroscience research and outreach.

name: Yale Nigerian Students Association
mission: The purpose of this group is to spread awareness of Nigerian culture to the Yale community by putting on new events and collaborating with other groups.
goals: Our goal this year is to expand our online and social media presence in order to bring together Nigerian and Nigerian-American students to learn about and celebrate their culture.

name: Yale NROTC Undergraduate Association
mission: We are committed to ensuring that all members have every opportunity to develop as young officers (for those who are NROTC midshipmen), and as Yale students, mentally, morally, and physically. Often, the cost of required NROTC events and training evolutions cannot be covered by official NROTC unit funds, meaning that the cost is passed down to the midshipmen. We want to ensure that no midshipmen is ever limited in their training as future officers, and therefore strive to provide them with the resources they need. As an organization, the three main resources we provide are (1) an inclusive community for all members, (2) financial assistance for ROTC training activities, and (3) events that connect Association members with the U.S. Navy, Yale NROTC alumni, and the many resources provided by Yale University.

name: Yale Out of the Blue
mission: Yale Out of the Blue (OOTB for short, pronounced "oot-bah") is a co-ed, undergraduate, pop-rock A Cappella group founded in 1986. Our primary aim is produce an innovative branch of A Cappella that delights audiences of all ages across the world. Within our group, we strive to foster an inclusive community, where people representing different backgrounds come together and sing in harmony. We aim to maintain a diverse repertoire of songs to include not only varying genres, but also artists of color.

name: Yale Outdoors
mission: Yale Outdoors serves the Yale community with high-quality and safe trips to explore the outdoors and develop wilderness skills. Yale Outdoors creates a community for students to meet and learn from others who are interested in the outdoors. Yale Outdoors provides affordable wilderness skills training sessions and outdoors equipment for the Yale community. Above all, Yale Outdoors spreads the love for the outdoors and appreciation for nature with the rest of the Yale community.

name: Yale Panhellenic Council - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The Yale Panhellenic Council is a representative government body that oversees the four sororities at Yale and coordinates formal Sorority Recruitment. We meet regularly to discuss  Greek life at Yale, as well as plan recruitment. Our job is to make recruitment as fun and simple as possible. We are at your disposal to answer any questions you might have in a non-biased, impartial way, and to help you through the recruitment process. We also hold events outside of recruitment period, including during Bulldog Days. ​We operate in accordance with the National Panhellenic Council rules and regulations. For information, please visit https://www.npcwomen.org/.

name: Yale Phi Alpha Theta Undergraduate History Honor Society
mission: Yale PAT is an undergraduate honor society whose purpose is to promote the study of history and its relevance to modern day society. The group aims to bring together students, teachers, and writers of history for a wide variety of intellectual and social exchanges during the academic year. Through these activities, Yale PAT supports historical inquiry, research, publication, good teaching, and the exchange of ideas among those with historical interests.

name: Yale Policy Institute
mission: We aim to empower students actively interested in the pressing issues around them with the resources necessary to impact change. By fostering a community of progressive activism on the Yale campus, we seek to inspire students to become leaders of their community at the local and national level.
benefits:
- Connect with real-world experts through partner organizations. 
- Access speaker events with leaders in your area of interest, such as Neera Tanden, former director of domestic policy for the Obama-Biden presidential campaign. 
- Learn important research skills through our workshops, which provide training in data analysis tools, policy writing, and more. 
- Gain hands-on research experience and learn how to structure and approach problems combining qualitative and quantitative aspects of a central question. 
- Mentorship and opportunities to meet with, work with, and learn from policy experts.
- Gain the opportunity to contribute to and be featured in your policy center’s final report and Op-Ed.

name: Yale Progressive Christian Student Organization
mission:
We hope to be authentic, connected, and engaged in and with the Yale and New Haven community.
Authentic: We strive to remind the community that self-worth is something not tied to grades or accomplishments. We value human diversity, affirming all of our members and standing against discrimination where it is found. 
Connected: We work to make connections across Yale’s schools and are open to Yale undergraduate, graduate, and professional students. We hope to create an inclusive and interdenominational Christian community that accepts differences in members’ denominations, theologies, and practices.
Engaged: We seek to follow the life and teachings of Jesus Christ and work to promote love, justice, and compassion on our campus and beyond.

name: Yale Project Bright: Undergraduate Renewable Energy Initiative
mission: Project Bright promotes solar energy at Yale and beyond through hands-on installation projects, educational outreach, and advocacy work.

name: Yale Queer+Asian - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale Queer + Asian is an organization dedicated to creating a space for people of Asian heritage who identify within the LGBTQ+ spectrum. We hold discussions examining the intersections of Asian and queer identity, invite guest speakers to present on their work and experiences and also aim to create a supportive, safe community where students are able to explore their identity and conflicts, and find fellow students who have had similar experiences. Collectively, we can build a strong community to bring attention to issues queer people of Asian heritage may face. We are associated with both the Co-Op and the AACC in their efforts on and off campus.

name: Yale Rangeela - An Undergraduate Organization
category: Cultural, Performance: Dance, AACC Affiliate Org
mission: Yale Rangeela is Yale University's first and only Bollywood fusion dance team. We seek to expose Yale's campus to a variety of fused dance styles and bring our vibrant energy to the stage.

name: Yale Rotaract Club: An Undergraduate Organization
mission: The purpose of Rotaract is to provide an opportunity for young men and women to enhance the knowledge and skills that will assist them in personal development, to address the physical and social needs of their communities, and to promote better relations between all people worldwide through a framework of friendship and service.
goals: To raise funds for international projects and participate in local service.

name: Yale Russian Chorus
mission: The Russian Chorus aims to provide a musical home for students with an interest in our unique repertoire and history. We bring cultures and people together through our outreach efforts in communities ranging from local churches to foreign concert halls.

name: Yale Scientific Magazine - An Undergraduate Publication
mission: The Yale Scientific Magazine is a student-run quarterly science publication featuring groundbreaking scientific research at Yale and beyond. Composed of writers, editors, photographers, artists, designers, and a business team, our interdisciplinary collective is united by the belief that science should be accessible and exciting to everyone—even those without a scientific background. This is exemplified not only in our magazine but in our outreach through Synapse, which hosts STEM outreach programs to empower New Haven youth. We hope you join our team of more than 100 students and over 2,000 worldwide subscribers as we share the stories of science.

name: Yale Slavic Chorus - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Our purpose is to share our love of traditional Eastern European and Balkan women's vocal music.

name: Yale Society of Physics Students
mission: The Yale Society of Physics Students seeks to promote mentorship, fellowship, and an esprit de corps within the physics communities at Yale. We do this by hosting study sessions, information panels, prize lectures, and other academic and social events — all aimed at connecting physics students, faculty, and the Department at large. We also support education, research, and outreach endeavors in physics, hosting a number of resources and student-oriented guides for members of SPS. We communicate with the Physics DUS and the Physics Department Chair’s office to ensure undergraduate input and involvement in administrative decisions. Yale SPS has been a registered chapter of the national Society of Physics Students, and an American Institute of Physics (AIP) member organization since 1998, as well as (soon-to-be) a chapter of the Sigma Pi Sigma honor society since 2020. Through our membership, we link Yale students with other SPS chapters and the national organization, so that they may benefit from a larger community and get access to scholarships, conferences, and other initiatives.
goals: This year, we intend to adapt our traditional academic and social events to a remote format that preserves our mission of providing a supportive communal space while being accessible to all students regardless of their location or enrollment status. We also aim to take advantage of our increased online activity by creating informational media, including infographics, videos, and an updated website to distribute resources aimed at demystifying what it entails to study physics and pursue a career in the field. Finally, we are also enthusiastic about restarting Yale SPS' outreach program, in which members participate in novel physics demonstrations for local secondary school students.

name: Yale Society of Women Engineers
mission: The Yale University section of the Society of Women Engineers will strive to create a strong community of engineers at Yale with a passion for engineering and commitment to women’s issues in the field in common. This community will not only serve women undergraduates, graduate students, and post doctoral fellows, but enthusiastically welcomes all with an interest in engineering, and in particular, an interest in women’s issues in engineering. The objectives of the organization are three-fold: creating an even stronger community of engineers on Yale’s campus, engaging in activities to support our professional development and enriching our academics, and reaching out to the Yale community as a whole to share our love of engineering with others.

name: Yale Spring Fling
mission: Spring Fling is Yale's annual spring music festival, and one of the largest live music events in Connecticut.

name: Yale State and Local Policy Review – an Undergraduate Journal
mission: The Journal’s mission is to curate high quality, original pieces focused on state and city level policy issues, useful to local, state, and federal policymakers as well as academics. These pieces will be written by college students around the country and many will be peer-reviewed.

name: Yale Student Academic Competitions
mission: Yale Student Academic Competitions both attends and hosts "Quiz Bowl" tournaments. We provide a welcoming environment for any interested student to participate in an all-subject buzzer-based competition rewarding deep knowledge of academic topics.

name: Yale Student Bakers
mission:
Our organization's purpose is to provide a space for students to enjoy baking together, and share that joy by learning from each other. We also give some of what we make to other students, and plan to partner with other student organizations to give back to the community. 
In addition, we hope to hold monthly bake sales in order to raise money for charities such as the American Cancer Society.

name: Yale Student Chapter of the American Institute of Chemical Engineers
mission: The purpose of this Chapter is to promote knowledge of chemical engineering and to promote mutual acquaintance and good fellowship among Yale chemical engineering students and between students and instructors, and to provide services when called upon in order to present a good image of the University to the community. The Chapter will contribute to the development of the chemical engineering community at Yale University through activities involving the faculty and student members as well as promoting the professional development of its members through its programs and facilitating networking opportunities with professionals, other Student Chapters, and with the parent body, the American Institute of Chemical Engineers.

name: Yale Student Environmental Coalition
mission: Empower students to engage in all forms of environmental activism on campus, in New Haven, and beyond. Foster a sense of community around people and earth at Yale, uniting networks of environmentalists as well as providing opportunities for students of all backgrounds to engage and share their perspectives on environmental issues.

name: Yale Student Financial Education Group
address: New Haven, CT  United States
mission: The mission of Yale FinEd shall be to explain, destigmatize, and democratize the field of finance and help members of the Yale community clarify their personal and professional financial goals. In particular, Yale FinEd shall improve financial literacy among the Yale community and thus help members take control of and responsibility for their financial future.
goals:
Did you know that credit cards offer hundreds of dollars in free money?
Or that by filing taxes, the typical college student actually gets paid by the government instead of vice versa?
Or that by investing $6k every year, you will almost certainly become a millionaire (in today's money) by retirement?
At Yale FinEd, we strive to educate Yalies on personal finance, a vital life skill that is rarely taught. Come learn how to leverage the U.S. financial system to build your own wealth.
We are a group of friends. Our atmosphere is informal rather than pre-professional, and practical rather than theoretical. Since our founding in 2018, we focus on three areas of personal finance:
- Investing: stocks, real estate, and retirement planning
- Taxes: tax forms, capital gains, tax efficiency, deductions, credits
- Budgeting & credit: credit scores, rewards, cashback, loan optimization
We primarily host talks and discussions by our leadership and guest speakers who are experts in these areas. Our current leadership includes students with backgrounds in investment banking, private equity, and big tech.

name: Yale Student Investment Group
mission: Our organization has three primary goals: to successfully manage and grow our portfolio, to thoroughly educate our members in the art and science of investing, and to maintain a close community of YSIG students and alums.

name: Yale Student Klezmer Band
mission: The Yale Student Klezmer Band aims to spread appreciation for Klezmer by teaching its members to be Klezmer musicians and by hosting performances throughout the year.

name: Yale Student Mental Health Association
category: Advocacy/Policy, Health/Wellness, Medical/Nursing/Public Health, Service/Volunteering, Social
mission: YSMHA hopes to create a forum for discussion around mental wellness and illness and includes three areas of focus: mental health 1) awareness, 2) policy and advocacy, and 3) community service and outreach.

name: Yale Student Quantitative Finance Organization
mission: To foster and encourage the empirical exploration of financial securities and opportunities by relying on modern computational and statistical techniques, in an environment of joint discovery, cooperation and interdisciplinarity. YSQFO is devoted to educating the Yale community about quantitative finance, both in theory and practice, as well as prepare members for future careers in the area. YSQFO is the umbrella organization for all things quant finance-related on campus, including the Yale Student Quantitative Research Group (YSQRG) and Yale Undergraduate Computational Finance Club (YUCFC).
goals: To educate members, provide adequate career networking and recruiting resources, and foster other professional development.

name: Yale Students for Christ
mission: The purpose of Yale Students for Christ (YSC) is live out faith, hope, and love in our campus, city, and world. We aim to provide an environment where Christian students can articulate and live out their faith collectively in a campus setting, and where any students can explore the Christian faith.

name: Yale Students Immersive Media
mission: We seek to build an interdisciplinary community blending art and technology to facilitate the development and exhibition of immersive media.

name: Yale Undergraduate Buddhist Sangha
category: Cultural, Health/Wellness, Religious/Spiritual, Cultural: Mixed Race
mission: Our organization aims to provide an ecumenical space for Buddhist study and practice which is accessible and valuable both for experienced practitioners and beginners looking to learn more.

name: Yale Undergraduate Certamen Committee
mission: We are Classics enthusiasts who host certamen tournaments for the Yale community and for high schoolers around the country. We seek to promote the study of the Classics and friendship among Latin students as we affirm the relevance of the ancient world in our modern era.

name: Yale Students of Mixed Heritage - an undergraduate organization
category: Cultural, AACC Affiliate Org, AfAm Affiliate Org, NACC Affiliate Org, La Casa  Affiliate Org, Cultural: Mixed Race
mission: Yale Students of Mixed Heritage is intended to be a space wherein students of more than one heritage, however they choose to self-identify (whether that be racial, ethnic, cultural, national, etc) feel welcome and included in the fullness of their identity. To that end, we are committed to being a bridge between the various cultural houses and student organizations of which our members belong while also creating a space to celebrate the identity unique to being blended or mixed. We also collaborate with similar student organizations across the country, including groups at Brown, Columbia, Harvard, UCLA, UC Berkeley, UT Austin, Middleburry, and several others.
goals: For this semester, given the COVID restrictions, we will be expanding our collaboration with other organizations. We are working on a nation-wide collegiate Mixed Facebook page, LinkedIn group, and potentially consistent Zoom meetings wherein we are able to meet with and collaborate with partner organizations. To follow Yale and state guidelines, we will be entirely remote this fall and have no in-person meetings.

name: Yale Summer Science Research Institute - an Undergraduate Organization
mission:
The Yale Summer Science Research Institute (SSRI) connects qualified high school students from the New Haven area with scientific research labs at Yale.  We hope to provide high-quality research experiences to New Haven students in order to excite them about scientific investigation, enable them to explore new scientific fields, and increase their college preparedness. In doing so, we hope to foster long-term relationships between Yale laboratories and qualified high school students who are enthusiastic about furthering the laboratories’ research.
 
The program also provides a framework for a mutually beneficial summer experience for both the students and labs.  Yale undergraduate students supplement lab work for the high school interns with organized workshops and other mentorship activities.  We also work to cultivate a sense of community among the students, organizing events to facilitate social interactions among the interns, as well as between the interns and their undergraduate, graduate, and professor mentors.
goals:
This year (Fall 2020), we would like to recruit enough Yale labs to host at least 10 high school students for summer internships. We would also like to recruit first years as members.
 
Next year (Spring 2021), we would also like to participate in the extracurricular bazaar during Bulldog Days in order to generate interest for the organization from incoming first year students.

name: Yale Undergraduate Aerial and Circus Arts Collective
mission: We provide Yalies with opportunities to continue their circus training on-campus and with potential performance opportunities.
goals: To grow our membership, develop a safe and encouraging environment to train, hopefully produce a show if conditions allow.

name: Yale Undergraduate Aerospace Association
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Aerospace Association promotes and advances aerospace engineering through collaboration, innovation, and outreach. YUAA cultivates leaders who meet challenges with discipline and creativity. Sometimes it is rocket science!
goals: YUAA members work in teams to build and fly rockets, planes, quadcopters, and unmanned aerial vehicles. From first idea to finished aircraft, YUAA projects are entirely student-run. Since 2010, YUAA has helped foster Yale’s engineering community by welcoming students of any experience level or background and hosting events to promote aerospace engineering on campus.

name: Yale Undergraduate Association for African Peace and Development
mission:
The Yale Undergraduate Association for African Peace and Development (YAAPD) seeks to ignite passion among students and youth at-large for conflict resolution, peace, and development on the continent. Cognizant of awareness, discourse, and action as a driver of continental development, the YAAPD hopes to prepare students’ and youth interested in Africa for efficacious and consequential careers focusing on Africa.
As a a resident group of the Afro-American Cultural Center at Yale, YAAPD aims to complement Yale’s liberal arts curriculum with a holistic approach to learning about development, peace, and conflict resolution. Acting from our core values of education, awareness, and service, YAAPD will bring together a community of scholars, professionals and activists who are integral in the pursuit of systematic advancement and development. YAAPD seeks to:
Develop networks among students and professionals across a spectrum of fields and interests with the aim of promoting peace and development within Africa.
Create awareness about issues facing Africa and provide a platform to discuss strategic ways that students on the continent and abroad can resolve these issues.
Encourage and develop, conflict resolution and development initiatives of students interested in Africa

name: Yale Undergraduate Ballet Company
mission: The purpose of YBC is to provide a space for students to continue dancing during their college careers, and to bring ballet to all interested students on Yale's campus. For company members, this includes not only weekly practice of ballet technique, but also choreographic opportunities and performances. The goal of the company is to successfully teach students about ballet and provide a space for students to practice and improve their technique, while also keeping them excited and engaged about the art form.
goals: We aim to provide students with the opportunity to maintain and further their practice of classical ballet, as well as to bring an appreciation of this art form to the broader community.

name: Yale Undergraduate Boat-Building Club
mission:
We aim to combine interests in engineering and design through building boats from scratch to ultimately be able to use ourselves.
We plan to make this project be inexpensive with relatively simple construction techniques.
We strive to teach about boat building as well as sailing to novices in both fields.

name: Yale Undergraduate Chamber Orchestra
mission:
Our purpose is to bring often-ignored chamber orchestra masterpieces into the limelight at Yale. Works like Strauss’s Metamorphosen, Bartok’s Music for Strings, Percussion, and Celesta, and the Lark Ascending are often excluded from the repertoire of current Yale ensembles. This is due to both instrumentation restrictions in the case of YSO, and ability restrictions in the case of the two college orchestras, as these pieces require a high technical and musical level. 
	We also seek to introduce new works for chamber orchestra into the repertoire. YUCO provides a space for up-and-coming composers to premiere their works in a welcoming, pre-professional environment, where they can be recorded and submitted to competitions and music schools. 
	YUCO is, first and foremost, a performance ensemble. YUCO can also be a meaningful stepping stone for composers, conductors, and instrumentalists on their way to graduate school and on their career paths. YUCO introduces repertoire to musicians and audience members alike that would have never played or heard otherwise.
goals: We hope to put on virtual concerts this Fall 2020, and create a sense of musical community online.

name: Yale Undergraduate Choral Society
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Choral Society (YUCS) is Yale's only non-audition choir. We make singing in a choral group accessible to anyone and everyone at Yale, regardless of a person's past singing experience or talent. As a low-stress choir, we provide an avenue for undergraduates to sing together. Our group consists of newcomers who want to learn how to sing as well as experienced singers who don't have time to join more time-intensive groups.

name: Yale Undergraduate Consulting Group
mission: YUCG seeks to provide students with the educational opportunity to work with real clients all over the world in order to address issues and solve problems unique to their businesses or organizations. We hope to establish an atmosphere that is both creative, intellectual and conducive to learning.

name: Yale Undergraduate Diversified Investments
mission:
YUDI (Yale Undergraduate Diversified Investments) is Yale’s largest undergraduate finance group and the only group focused primarily on investment banking and private equity. We ensure members achieve success in the recruitment process, and past members have gone onto Goldman Sachs, Blackstone, Warburg Pincus, Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan and other premier firms.
We provide a rigorous educational curriculum, personalized mentorship, exclusive networking events, M&A case competitions, and firm visits that will ensure your placement at a top firm.

name: Yale Undergraduate Dungeons and Dragons Organization
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Dungeons and Dragons Organization aims to build a community on campus dedicated to the cultivation of critical workplace skills such as leadership, communication, and team-building skills through the forum of Dungeons and Dragons.

name: Yale Undergraduate Esports Club
mission: With Esports gaining more and more popularity around the world – even introduced as a demonstration sport in the 2018 Asian Games – Yale Esports’ mission is to promote a place for  competitive/casual video gamers and Esports fans to come together and enjoy the great excitement and thrill of various games such as League of Legends, Overwatch, and FIFA.

name: Yale Undergraduate Ethics Bowl
mission: The Yale Ethics Bowl strives to provide an outlet for discussions on philosophy through participation in the Intercollegiate Ethics Bowl competition.

name: Yale Undergraduate Film Alliance
mission: The Yale Film Alliance is a collaborative effort on the part of undergraduates, student groups, university representatives, and alumni that aims to strengthen and provide more cohesive support for those interested in the film industry, the art of cinema, and other moving image media.

name: Yale Undergraduate Global Health Review
mission: The Yale Global Health Review aims to provide undergraduate and graduate students with information on current issues in global health. Using a combination of original research, opinion pieces, interviews, and informational reviews, we connect the Yale community with areas of global health that impact us all.
goals:
-publish two print issues of our publication
-expand readership for both our print and online articles
-improve the design and layout of the online website

name: Yale Undergraduate Gospel Choir
mission: Spreading the Gospel of Jesus Christ through song
goals:
To raise funds for our annual tour 
To retain a strong member base 
To maintain an endowment for future tours

name: Yale Undergraduate HOSA
mission: The mission of HOSA is to enhance the delivery of compassionate, quality health care by providing opportunities for knowledge, skill and leadership development of all health science education students, therefore, helping the student meet the needs of the health care community.

name: Yale Undergraduate Jashan Bhangra
category: Cultural, Performance: Dance, AACC Affiliate Org
mission: Yale Jashan Bhangra is a dance troupe that celebrates the vibrant South Asian dance known as bhangra. Our purpose is to connect the greater Yale population to the fun, colorful traditions of South Asia through on-campus performances, workshops, and cultural events.

name: Yale Undergraduate Jazz Collective
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Jazz Collective aims to foster a community around jazz music on campus. We host concerts, discussions, jam sessions, and masterclasses to establish both performance and educational opportunities for students and members of the New Haven community. In addition, we lobby for a formal jazz curriculum at Yale.

name: Yale Undergraduate Kalaa
category: Cultural, Performance: Dance, AACC Affiliate Org
mission:
We are Yale's newest Indian Classical Dance group. As of now, our group includes Bharatanatyam, Kathak and Kuchipudi dancers. 
'The Yale Kalaa' is a hub through which trained classical undergraduate and graduate dancers can get the opportunity to start performing for various events on campus. The team usually has weekly two hour practices and each dance form usually practices another 3-4 hours/month. If you have any experience in classical dance, we would love to hear from you!
In case you were wondering, 'Kalaa' (pronounced "cuh-laa") is a Sanskrit word meaning "a skilled craft" and we take our craft seriously. We use our craft to celebrate and share the joy of classical dance.

name: Yale Undergraduate Keepers of Innocence
mission: The purpose of YUKI is to bring together a diverse group of people for a variety of social activities, and to share upon those experiences in a relaxed environment while enjoying chocolate milk.

name: Yale Undergraduate Legal Aid Association
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Legal Aid Association is an organization open to young, human rights and legal aid-interested undergraduate students, which focuses primarily on offering its members volunteer opportunities on various legal projects in the greater New Haven area throughout the semester. We also organize advocacy events on campus to expand awareness on legal issues that pertain especially to the criminal justice system, immigration, refugee resettlement, and asylum-seeking.
goals:
- Engage volunteers in direct-service work with local non-profit organizations and New Haven residents.
- Continue with partnerships established from this summer for the 2020-2021 academic year.
- Offer YULAA volunteers with events that connect them with lawyers/policymakers working in advocacy and the non-profit world, offer law school prep (LSAT, Admissions, etc), and build a strong community within YULAA.

name: Yale Undergraduate LGBTQ Cooperative
mission: The Co-op works to foster a sense of community among all queer & LGBTQ+ identified people at Yale. We serve as a media and administrative representative of the LGBTQ+ community and work to provide safe spaces and meeting opportunities for queer & LGBTQ+ students.

name: Yale Undergraduate Linguistics Society
mission: YULS seeks to foster a strong community of people at Yale interested in linguistics, and to bring awareness and excitement about the field of linguistics to middle and high school students in the New Haven area by hosting a site for the North American Computational Linguistics Olympiad (NACLO).

name: Yale Undergraduate Mathematics Society
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Mathematics Society, or YUMS, aims to create and foster a community for undergraduates at Yale interested in mathematics. It does so by hosting a number of events for math students, including colloquia, study sessions, game nights, and panels about the math major and summer opportunities.

name: Yale Undergraduate Mock Trial Association
category: Academic, Leadership, Performance: Other, Pre-Professional, Speech/Debate
mission: The Yale College Mock Trial Association is an undergraduate organization that seeks to promote student interest in the law and the American judicial system through participation in intercollegiate mock trial competition.

name: Yale Undergraduate Moot Court Team
mission:
We are a team of undergraduate students at Yale University who are passionate about the law. Our team members have a wide variety of interests and majors, but we all enjoy preparing for and competing in the American Moot Court Association Competition each year. We love teaching anyone we can about how interesting and important moot court and the law are.
If you’re interested in getting involved in moot court, you’ll find many more resources on this website, or you can contact us directly!

name: Yale Undergraduate Mountaineering League
mission: Our mission is to promote and foster the sport of mountaineering among members of the Yale community. We are a community of and for experienced hikers, climbers, and mountaineers created to advance and learn from each other's eclectic outdoor experiences. This group would primarily cater to individuals in the Yale community who already have ample wilderness experience by organizing and funding large-scale outings and expeditions.

name: Yale Undergraduate Net Impact
mission: Yale Undergraduate Net Impact (YUNI) is an on-campus consulting firm working for socially responsible businesses, ranging in size from Fortune 500 companies to not-for-profits. Net Impact's semester-long consulting projects are professional, in-depth efforts that provide lasting value to our clients, for whom we tackle the toughest business challenges.

name: Yale Undergraduate Photography Society
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Photography Society aims to share the vast photographic resources on campus, display student work, advise beginners, and serve as a network for student photographers.

name: Yale Undergraduate Piano Collective
mission: One of the hallmarks of Yale College is its renowned musical community. Outstanding instrumental musicians on campus frequently perform together in such well-regarded ensembles as the Yale Symphony Orchestra and the Yale Concert Band. Pianists, however, are required only in small numbers for these groups and may therefore find themselves somewhat isolated in their musical pursuit. Therefore, the Yale Undergraduate Piano Collective exists to promote greater musical and social cohesion among the undergraduate pianists at Yale. In particular, the YUPC organizes "studio classes," wherein pianists to play for each other to receive feedback and encounter fresh perspectives, and public performances, with an emphasis on collaborative repertoire for four, six, and eight hands.

name: Yale Undergraduate Poker Club
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Poker Club's mission is to promote the play of poker as a game of skill. We believe that poker is both a fun and intellectually stimulating activity that can be played by everyone.

name: Yale Undergraduate Pre-Veterinary Society
mission: This organization serves to inform its members on current opportunities in veterinary medicine including research and shadowing, to provide advice on the veterinary school application process, and to establish a volunteering relationship with veterinary and animal-related communities.

name: Yale Undergraduate Rec Tennis
mission: We coordinate time on the courts for Yalees who want to play regularly without the commitment of Club or the flakiness of IMs. Add your friends who would be interested. We will meet on weekends for friendly hitting and match play. All levels welcome.

name: Yale Undergraduate Research Association
mission: Our mission is to support the undergraduate research community, and to provide information, resources, and advising for students interested in research at Yale.
goals: Our goals are to support a robust research experience at Yale through implementing a graduate-undergraduate mentorship program, and undergraduate research journal, regular campus events, and strong relationships with Yale organizations and departments.

name: Yale Undergraduate Science Olympiad
mission: To create a Science Olympiad invitational accessible to high school students from across the nation, including those who are competing for the first time or come from small schools.

name: Yale Undergraduate Super Smash Club
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Super Smash Club seeks to create an inclusive and educational environment not only for longtime fans of Nintendo's Super Smash Bros, but also for anyone interested in venturing into the world of both casual and competitive gaming. Through the global medium of Smash Bros, we aim to build a welcoming community dedicated to developing critical skills for university life and beyond, including the personal growth mindset, persistence-based learning, and effective team-working.

name: Yale Undergraduate Synapse (Outreach) of Yale Scientific Magazine
mission: Synapse is the community outreach branch of the Yale Scientific Magazine. We organize and host a wide variety of events which connect both Yale undergraduates and the greater New Haven community to Yale's exceptional scientific resources. Undergraduates, graduate students, and professors volunteer to help Synapse create unique educational experiences that show that science is both accessible, compelling, and empowering. We organize lectures and demonstrations designed to spark young students’ interests in STEM. We collaborate closely with Yale Pathways to Science, a non-profit associated with Yale University and the Office of New Haven and State Affairs.

name: Yale Undergraduate Venture Group
mission:
The Yale Undergraduate Venture Group has two main goals: 
(1) use the insights of Yale students to provide enhanced analysis and carry out due-diligences for early-stage investment firms (Venture Capital) in order to make investment decisions 
(2) source startups from the rapidly-growing Yale entrepreneurial community and connect them with our network of early-stage investors

name: Yale Undergraduate Women in STEM
mission: Yale Women in Science (YWS) is an undergraduate organization dedicated to supporting the community of women at Yale interested in science, math, and engineering. Through dinners with professors at Yale, Girls' Science Investigations, the WISAY mentoring program and other activites, YWS aims to provide unique opportunities to female and underrepresented students in the sciences.

name: Yale Undergraduate Women's Health Journal
mission: Yale Undergraduate Women’s Health Journal aims to raise awareness about reproductive health within and without the realm of sexuality and encourage and normalize the conversation about the human body and its care. Through weekly publications, student surveys, and guest panels, WHYJ wants to create an inclusive environment where students are equipped with the tools to make healthy decisions and feel encouraged to seek support.

name: Yogis at Yale - An Undergraduate Organization
mission: Our mission is to make professional quality yoga instruction available to all members of the Yale community, regardless of level or financial means.

name: Yale Undergraduate Young Democratic Socialists
mission: Our hope is that we can gather together and find our way forward. Forward, through racism, misogyny, homophobia and hate. Forward, here at Yale and New Haven. Forward, by creating alternative spaces of resistance. Forward, towards an equitable, communal society here in New Haven and beyond.

name: Yale Undergraduates at Connecticut Hospice
mission: Yale Undergraduates at Connecticut Hospice (YUCH) is an organization that provides the unique opportunity to work at a palliative care facility a short drive away from campus in Branford, CT. Volunteers provide a service that is crucial to the Hospice organization and uplifting to the patients. There are a variety of volunteer departments ranging from patient assistance to art therapy, which all immerse volunteers in the real patient care experience.

name: Yale Undergraduates for UNICEF
mission: ​Yale UNICEF is a member group of the United Nations International Children’s Fund Campus Initiative that aims to raise awareness about children’s issues—including poverty, development, safety, rights, health, education, and inclusion in their communities. Additionally, Yale UNICEF strives to contribute to efforts made on behalf of children both locally and internationally. Yale UNICEF hopes to inspire and empower members of the Yale community by providing them with both opportunities and tools to engage in student leadership, activism, and community service work on behalf of children worldwide.
goals:
We plan to conduct accessible virtual Zoom meetings at least once per month to connect with members.  
We plan to educate, advocate, and fund raise on behalf of UNICEF USA with regular planning and registered events.

name: Yale Undergraduates of Phi Beta Kappa
mission: YPBK exists to strengthen the undergraduate community of PBK inductees at Yale University. As a constituent organization of the national Phi Beta Kappa Society, YPBK reflects the goals and values of the broader PBK community. PBK was founded in 1776 in order to promote and celebrate excellence in the liberal arts and sciences. The Yale chapter of PBK, Alpha of Connecticut, was founded in 1780. A society of scholars and ideas, the Yale chapter holds as its central mission the pursuit of “lux et veritas” (light and truth). YPBK not only seeks to encourage intellectual engagement but also to foster social bonds between students, based on a shared passion for learning and knowledge.

name: Yale University Chapter of Out in Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Out in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics is a national LGBTQ- affirming organization that aims to provide services and support for LGBTQ students in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics and to create a dynamic network between students and professionals in industry and academia.

name: Yale University Dramatic Association, Inc.
mission: The Yale Dramat is dedicated to producing inclusive and diverse theater - that is accessible to the Yale - New Haven community and intends to impact these communities, through conversation, performance, and education, - as well as upholding the Dramat’s long tradition of fine theater.

name: Yale University Undergraduate Women in Economics
mission: The goal of the Women in Economics organization is to support women pursuing a degree in economics and to introduce more undergraduate women to the field. To do so, we showcase the wide variety of fields within economics; bring together undergraduates, graduate students, and faculty; and host events that celebrate the achievements of the women in the discipline. We are dedicated to building a broad, supportive, and engaged community within the department.

name: Yale Women's Athletic Council: An Undergraduate Empowerment Group
mission: This council aims to unite and empower the female athletic community at Yale through fostering positive conversation and creating a community of acceptance. Our goal is to promote the physical and emotional well-being of female athletes on campus through various initiatives, speakers, and events.

name: Yaledancers - An Undergraduate Organization
mission:
Yaledancers is Yale's oldest premiere dance company. Since 1973, YD has provided Yale student dancers with access to high caliber training and performance opportunities. YD meets twice weekly for classes, taught by both industry professionals and fellow company members, on top of rehearsals for our two semester shows (Fall and Spring), which showcase original guest and student choreography here at Yale. The company performs a wide variety of dance styles, including classical and modern, ballet, jazz, contemporary, tap, musical theatre, and modern dance. YD also provides a social outlet and sense of community for members, creating lasting friendships among both graduate and undergraduate students.
​
Yaledancers is also a founding member of the Alliance for Dance at Yale. ADAY serves as a collective forum for dance groups at Yale and provides classes, support, and the Dance Symposium to the Yale dance community.

name: YaleMakes Student Organization
mission: YaleMakes is a community of students at Yale who are interested in practicing and learning design and construction from a broad range of disciplines. We organize workshops and speaker events led by students and practitioners several times a semester, and publish a weekly design newsletter.

name: Yalies for Pakistan
mission: Yalies for Pakistan seeks to showcase Pakistan to the broader Yale community. We intend to provide students with a community, a home away from home, and a platform to discuss Pakistani culture, politics, and current affairs.

name: Yale Environmental Law Association (SIG)
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups

name: Young Israel House at Yale
mission: Young Israel House at Yale (YIHY) represents the Orthodox Jewish community at Yale, catering to the needs of observant Jews on campus.  As a group, we arrange minyan services, Jewish learning initiatives, and other activities and events  for the Yale Jewish community at large.

name: Yale Concert Band
mission:
The Yale Bands is a thriving cultural community. Its members are given opportunities to prepare and perform great music; learn about the arts and their place in society and international cultures; and develop skills to become leaders. Through a robust series of musical activities, many Bands members work with and become serious performers, conductors, composers, arrangers, writers, archivists, historians, photographers, producers, choreographers, media producers, critics, and teachers. Band members develop and master these skills through service to the University, performing and producing commencement music, benefit concerts, university ceremonies, theater shows, international tours, reading sessions for classes, and special events.
The Yale Concert Band is an ensemble of 45-60 wind, brass, and percussion players that perform repertoire ranging from wind band classics to premieres, commissions, and the newest wind band literature.  All Yale Concert Band activities will be virtual for the fall semester. AUDITION MATERIALS:  https://bands.yalecollege.yale.edu/audition-info-fall-2020-yale-concert-band.

name: Yale Connect Administrators - for School or Unit Administrators (Group Type Admins)
Yale Creative Society
mission: YCS's mission is to provide space and community for aspiring creators of all kinds. Whether you create to publish, introspect, explore, dream, relax, tune out, tune in, or tune up, YCS is where you belong.

name: Yale Divinity Drama
category: Academic, Arts: Other, Media/Technology, Performance: Comedy, Performance: Dance, Performance: Instruments, Performance: Other, Performance: Singing, Performance: Theater, Religious/Spiritual, Social
benefits: Div Drama is a space of experimentation, inspiration, and plenty of perspiration (especially the week before a show). If you are looking to explore your inner-player this semester, join our spirited band of thespians, singers, dancers, and performers. We welcome anyone and everyone.

name: Yale Divinity School Government
address:
409 Prospect Street
New Haven, CT 06511 United States
mission:
The purpose of the Student Government shall be the following:
To act as the legislative assembly of the student body of Yale Divinity School (the “Divinity School” or “YDS”).
To serve as the primary representative of the student body before the faculty and administration of the Divinity School.
To act on behalf of the students and their interests on issues of YDS policy and community concern.
To advocate for the interests of the Divinity School students within the broader Yale University community.

name: Yale e-NABLE - Student Chapter
mission: Yale e-NABLE seeks to join the global e-NABLE community in providing free, customizable 3D printed upper limb assistive devices to those in need. The Yale chapter focuses on reaching the broader New Haven community with e-NABLE prosthetic designs and has the unique opportunity to collaborate with a digital network of e-NABLE community members.

name: Yale Education Tutoring Initiative - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: The YETI Study Hall, a free academic resource, connects undergraduate tutors with New Haven youth through a tailored match-making process according to scheduling availability, academic subjects, and any other area of noted interests or need for expertise. Our goal is to provide structure, accountability, support, academic tutoring, and mentorship to youth in the New Haven area as they navigate online learning.

name: Yale Emergency Medical Service – an Undergraduate Organization
mission: The purpose of this organization is to create a safer and healthier campus environment by providing comprehensive training in emergency medical care and by reducing morbidity and mortality.
goals: Yale EMS will provide service in areas determined by its Executive Director and Medical Director for their designees, in consultation with Yale EMS. Areas of service may include but are not limited to: standby emergency medical service at athletic gatherings, campus-wide events (e.g. YHack, the YSO Halloween Show, Commencement, etc.), YEMS-sponsored EMT classes, and CPR/AED/First Aid classes.

name: Yale Entertainment and Sports Law Association
mission: The Yale Entertainment and Sports Law Association (YESLA) endeavors to expose members and the broader YLS community to important legal topics in the Sports and Entertainment industries. YESLA plans to host a number of speakers and organize trips to various events.

name: Yale Environment 360 Magazine
mission: Yale Environment 360 is an online magazine offering opinion, analysis, reporting, and debate on global environmental issues. We feature original articles by scientists, journalists, environmentalists, academics, policy makers, and business people, as well as multimedia content and a daily digest of major environmental news.

name: Yale Environment Women (YEW)
type: Yale School of the Environment Student Groups

name: Yale Environmental Law Association (YELA)
mission: The Yale Environmental Law Association (YELA) provides a home for students interested in environmental law and concerned about the climate crisis. YELA draws attention to all aspects of environmental law, environmental justice, and related fields through YLS community events, speakers and reading groups, and opportunities to connect and collaborate with other campus groups. YELA also serves as a hub for climate and environmental activism at YLS and beyond. YELA places special emphasis on the interdisciplinary, multifaceted character of environmental law and its relevance to a wide range of legal and policy issues.

name: Yale European Graduate Student Society
mission: A space for European students and European enthusiasts at the graduate and professional level at Yale, facilitating friendships, networking and discussion. This group will serve both as an informal way to network and to invite speakers and have conversations about topics related to Europe.

name: Yale Federalist Society
mission: The Federalist Society is founded on three core principles: We believe that the state exists to preserve freedom. We believe that the separation of governmental powers is central to our Constitution. And we believe that it is emphatically the province and duty of the judiciary to say what the law is, not what it should be.

name: Yale Food Law Society
mission: The Yale Food Law Society (FoodSoc) is a nonpartisan community that promotes the study of and engagement with food and agriculture law and policy. FoodSoc advocates an approach that is economically, environmentally, and socially sustainable.

name: Yale Forest Forum
address:
360 Prospect Street
New Haven, CT 06511 United States
mission: The Yale Forest Forum offers weekly lunch talks during the academic year, providing opportunities to hear from leaders in forest management, conservation, or policy in an informal setting. The YFF speaker series is the longest continuously-running speaker series at the Yale School of the Environment. Speakers come from a wide range of organizations and perspectives, including government, NGOs and businesses, working at scales from local to international.

name: Yale Glee Club
mission:
The Yale Glee Club is Yale’s principal undergraduate mixed choir and oldest musical organization, currently in its 160th season.
Our plans for Fall 2020: Like choirs throughout the world, we will not be able to do many of the things we normally do this coming fall, but we are committed to maintaining the Glee Club as a vibrant community for Yale students who love to sing by making music together however we can, learning, serving our community, and cultivating connections with each other.

name: Yale Grad crew
mission: While camaraderie between the members is emphasized, the primary goal of the club is to field competitive squads in rowing regattas versus other business schools and post-collegiate clubs.

name: Yale Graduate Consulting Club
mission: Our mission at the YGCC is to provide a platform for Yale graduate students to learn about and prepare for productive careers in management consulting by transforming Yale into a prime recruiting ground for top firms.

name: Yale Graduate Rugby Football Club
mission: This club has active Men's and Women's teams and provides the opportunity to break out of the bubble of your graduate program and make friends from all the other graduate schools, as well as meeting graduate students from around the world on the teams we play against, all while competing in one of the world’s greatest sports - rugby. Each year, YGRFC participates in some of the greatest Rugby Tournaments across the country, including Hogfest at Wharton in the fall, as well as the MBA Rugby World Cup at Duke in the spring.

name: Yale Graduate Society of Women Engineers
mission: The Graduate Society of Women Engineers (gradSWE) is a forum to connect grad students interested in the inclusion of women in engineering within the broader engineering community. Through our activities, we seek to provide both personal and professional development, in order to support female engineering students on the path to an advanced degree and in their careers after graduating.

name: Yale Graduate Student Book Club
mission: The purpose of this organization is to create a literary community by connecting passionate readers, providing a platform to exchange peer reviews and creating a safe environment for public speaking and respectful debate.

name: Yale Graduate Student Christian Fellowship
mission:
We are a community of Christians who encourage one another in developing our gifts, education and passions to glorify God in our current scholarship and future professions. We seek to engage other graduate students and the broader Yale and New Haven communities with Christ’s message of God’s love that renews and redeems the world.
As an affiliated chapter of the Graduate and Faculty Ministry (GFM) of InterVarsity Christian Fellowship, we also embrace their mission statement, which is:  The mission of GFM is to encourage and equip graduate students and faculty to follow Christ as they seek to be a redeeming influence among the people, ideas, and structures of the university and professions.
We invite you to join our e-mail list to stay informed about our activities: http://mailman.yale.edu/mailman/listinfo/ygcf

name: Yale Undergraduate Strategic Technology Policy Group
Yale GSAS Student Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Club
mission: Build a Decentralized, Cohesive & Supportive Ecosystem for every Yalie who has passion in Blockchain and Cryptocurrency
goals:
Yale GSAS Student Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Club is a non-profit student-run club and devoted to support local community to thrive in blockchain and cryptocurrency. The goals are but not limited to:
1. We aim to educate graduate students and greater community on the technology, application, investment strategy and market of blockchain and cryptocurrency by inviting  speakers from academy and industry .
2. We aim to to provide a platform for cross-campus interdisciplinary collaborations and tech innovations in the fields of blockchain and cryptocurrency via seminars and workshops. 
3. We aim to provide group members with professional networks, career opportunities and exclusive internship through the connections with our off-campus collaborators and Yale alumni. 
4. We aim to organize standing study groups and social events to boost learning efficiency and group cohesion.

name: Yale Hands-On Pathology (YHOP)
mission: Yale Hands-On Pathology (YHOP) aims to promote interest in Laboratory Medicine and Pathology by providing students with hands-on laboratory experiences led by Yale faculty and trainees.

name: Yale Health - Member Services
mission: Yale Health promotes the health and well-being of every member of the Yale community, so that each individual can achieve their highest goals and aspirations. Providing consistently outstanding care, compassionate, patient-centered service and innovative practices is our promise to our members and Yale University.

name: Yale Health Law and Policy Society
mission: The Yale Health Law and Policy Society (YHeLPS) serves as a central hub for health-related programming at the Yale Law School. YHeLPS invites speakers, plans career info sessions and networking events, organizes experiential learning opportunities like the medical-legal partnerships, and coordinates with other health organizations throughout Yale University.

name: Yale Immigrant Justice Project
address: New Haven, Conn
mission: The Yale Immigrant Justice Project (IJP) organizes law students in support of immigrant communities in the Greater New Haven area and around the country. Law students engage in projects involving direct legal services, assisting with strategic litigation, and drafting appeals of immigration decisions. As they stand, immigration policies exist to disorient and dehumanize those who wish to make their home in the U.S. We envision a different future in which no one has to live in fear because of their documentation status. We hope to use the skills, privileges, and opportunities our law degrees give us to work towards making that a reality.

name: Yale International Relations Association - An Undergraduate Organization
category: Advocacy/Policy, International Affairs, Leadership, Political, Pre-Professional, Professional, Publication, Service/Volunteering, Speech/Debate
mission:
After the political turbulence of the 1960s, a group of Yale students came together seeking to promote a better understanding of global affairs. As a result, in 1969, the Yale International Relations Association (YIRA) was founded. 
The Yale International Relations Association strives to foster conversation about international relations on campus and beyond through conferences, classes, travel, publications, and speaker and social events. We aim to create an inclusive, diverse, and accessible educational space for students, providing resources that enrich public speaking, leadership, critical analysis, and problem-solving abilities so members may best apply their passion for international relations and give back to the world.

name: Yale Jazz Ensemble
mission:
The Yale Bands is a thriving cultural community. Its members are given opportunities to prepare and perform great music; learn about the arts and their place in society and international cultures; and develop skills to become leaders. Through a robust series of musical activities, many Bands members work with and become serious performers, conductors, composers, arrangers, writers, archivists, historians, photographers, producers, choreographers, media producers, critics, and teachers. Band members develop and master these skills through service to the University, performing and producing commencement music, benefit concerts, university ceremonies, theater shows, international tours, reading sessions for classes, and special events.
The Yale Jazz Ensemble is a seventeen-piece big band that performs a wide variety of music, from pieces from Yale’s Benny Goodman archive to the newest, most progressive jazz compositions.  All Yale Jazz Ensemble activities will be virtual for the fall semester. AUDITION MATERIALS: https://bands.yalecollege.yale.edu/audition-info-fall-2020-yale-jazz-ensemble

name: Yale Jazz Initiative-Combo Coaching Program
mission:
The Yale Bands is a thriving cultural community. Its members are given opportunities to prepare and perform great music; learn about the arts and their place in society and international cultures; and develop skills to become leaders. Through a robust series of musical activities, many Bands members work with and become serious performers, conductors, composers, arrangers, writers, archivists, historians, photographers, producers, choreographers, media producers, critics, and teachers. Band members develop and master these skills through service to the University, performing and producing commencement music, benefit concerts, university ceremonies, theater shows, international tours, reading sessions for classes, and special events.
All Yale Jazz initiative Combo coaching activities will be virtual for the fall semester: https://bands.yalecollege.yale.edu/fall-2020-yale-jazz-initiative-jazz-combo-coaching-program#overlay-context=

name: Yale Jewish Law Students' Association
mission: The Yale Jewish Law Students Association (JLSA) is an affinity group that organizes and hosts academic, cultural, religious, and social events including Shabbat and holiday meals, faculty dinners, and lectures.

name: Yale Journal of Biology and Medicine
mission: The Yale Journal of Biology and Medicine (YJBM) is a graduate and medical student-run, peer-reviewed, open-access journal dedicated to the publication of original research articles, scientific reviews, articles on medical history, personal perspectives on medicine, policy analyses, case reports, and symposia related to biomedical matters. YJBM is published quarterly and aims to publish articles of interest to both physicians and scientists. YJBM is and has been an internationally distributed journal with a long history of landmark articles. Our contributors feature a notable list of philosophers, statesmen, scientists, and physicians, including Ernst Cassirer, Harvey Cushing, Rene Dubos, Edward Kennedy, Donald Seldin, and Jack Strominger. Our Editorial Board consists of students and faculty members from Yale School of Medicine and Yale University Graduate School of Arts & Sciences. All manuscripts submitted to YJBM are first evaluated on the basis of scientific quality, originality, appropriateness, contribution to the field, and style. Suitable manuscripts are then subject to rigorous, fair, and rapid peer review.

name: Yale Journal of Health Policy, Law, and Ethics
mission: The Yale Journal of Health Policy, Law, and Ethics (YJHPLE) strives to provide a forum for interdisciplinary discussion on topics in health policy, health law, and biomedical ethics.

name: Yale Journal of International Affairs
type: The Jackson Institute for Global Affairs

name: Yale Journal of International Law
mission: The Yale Journal of International Law (YJIL) is a student-run law journal devoted to scholarship on international, transnational and comparative law.

name: Yale Journal of Law & the Humanities
mission: The Yale Journal of Law & the Humanities publishes scholarship at the intersection of law and the humanities.

name: Yale Journal of Law and Feminism
mission: The Yale Journal of Law and Feminism is committed to publishing scholarship on gender, sexuality, and the law, especially insofar as the law structures, affects, or ignores the experiences of women and other marginalized peoples. We encourage the submission of articles, essays, and reviews concerning these intersections of law and feminism. As we promote feminist principles to our readers, we also practice those principles ourselves. All members contribute to our Journal's management, making major decisions through modified consensus.

name: Yale Journal of Law and Technology
mission: The Yale Journal of Law and Technology (YJoLT) offers a network of tech-focused law students and exposure to cutting-edge legal scholarship. If you are passionate about robotics, science, privacy and beyond, join our community!

name: Yale Journal on Regulation
mission: The Yale Journal on Regulation (JREG) is a biannual student-edited law review covering regulatory, administrative, corporate law topics. It is the top-ranked journal in the fields of corporate, administrative, bankruptcy, and commercial law in the United States.

name: Yale Law & Business Society
mission: The Yale Law & Business Society (YLBS) connects students interested in corporate law, business, entrepreneurship, corporate social responsibility, and regulation. YLBS presents lectures and workshops and organizes networking events to support the academic and professional interests of our members. In its programming, the Society works closely with the faculty at YLS and the Yale School of Management (SOM) and both schools’ alumni.

name: Yale Law & Philosophy Society
mission: YLPS aims to offer both formal and informal activities for students interested in philosophy and law. The organization is committed to fostering engagement with legal-philosophical ideas by sponsoring reading groups, hosting guest speakers, and creating a social community on campus.

name: Yale Law & Policy Review
mission: The Yale Law & Policy Review (YLPR) is a biannual publication of the Yale Law School dedicated to publishing legal scholarship and policy proposals by lawmakers, judges, practitioners, academics, and students.

name: Yale Law & Technology Society
mission: The Yale Law & Technology Society (TechSoc) is a nonpartisan organization that helps foster Yale’s growing community, debate, and scholarship at the intersection of law and technology. We define “technology” broadly, covering topics including: data and privacy, network neutrality, hacktivism and social movements, mobile currency, wireless spectrum, start-ups, cybersecurity, information sharing, energy, health IT, access to knowledge, artificial intelligence, and more.

name: Yale Law Christian Fellowship
mission: The Yale Law Christian Fellowship (YLCF) is an open community of Christians aiming to serve and love God and each other, and to demonstrate the love of Jesus Christ to the community around us.

name: Yale Law National Security Group
mission: The Yale Law National Security Group aims to foster a non-partisan community focused on national security and foreign policy within the law school.

name: Yale Law Republicans
mission: The Yale Law Republicans facilitate connections between students and conservative campaigns and Republican officials, both elected and appointed. We sponsor speaker and internal events.

name: Yale Law Veterans Association
mission: The Yale Law Veteran's Association represents the interests of current and former members of the military at Yale Law School.

name: Yale Machine Learning - an Undergraduate Organization
Yale MD-PhD Program
mission: MD-PhD students at Yale enjoy tremendous human, intellectual and physical resources during their clinical training and graduate education. We are committed to creating a rigorous, yet flexible training program that addresses each student’s interests and professional goals and makes full use of the outstanding research and clinical training opportunities at Yale. Our collaborative faculty and students, drawn from the Schools of Medicine, Public Health, Engineering and Applied Sciences, and Arts & Sciences, create an environment that values curiosity, creativity, diversity and integrity—and look for opportunities to have a positive impact on our local community and the greater world. And our hospitals and clinics share our mission of using cutting-edge science to improve patient care and outcomes. If you are ready to accept the challenges, responsibilities and rewards of preparing for a career that makes a positive impact on human health and well-being, we invite you to learn more about MD-PhD training at Yale.

name: Yale Med Films
mission: Yale Med Films seeks to unite the medical school community through the power of filmmaking and storytelling. We make videos for events such as the Hunger and Homelessness Auction, Second Year Show, and Second Look Weekend.

name: Yale Med School Intramural Soccer Club
Yale Med School Intramural Softball Club
Yale Mentorship for Minority Students in STEM
mission: YMMSS is a mentorship program that aims to connect more senior underrepresented STEM students (racial/ethnic minorities, LGBTQ+ students, students with disabilities, etc.) with younger students seeking mentorship.

name: Yale Mexican Graduate Student Society
mission: The Yale Mexican Graduate Society's mission is to further the presence of Mexico in campus, through the organization of cultural, social, professional and academic events.

name: Yale Middle Eastern North African Student Association
Yale Neuroscience Outreach Group - a graduate student association
mission: The mission of our organization is to promote interest in STEM and exposure to neuroscience to students early in their academic careers. We aim to help middle school and high school students learn about the brain, meet neuroscientists that are approachable, fun, and diverse, and hopefully inspire some to consider science as a possible career path.

name: Yale Office of Global Health Education
Yale Patient Navigator Program
mission: A student collaboration between the Yale School of Medicine, Yale School of Nursing, and the Yale Physician Associate Program, the Yale Navigator Program aims to identify and address barriers to care by connecting patients with community-based health and psychosocial resources. We value holistic, patient-centered care that respects the diverse priorities and identities of our patients. We strive to lessen gaps in current medical practice by encouraging communication and collaboration between patients, students, and healthcare and community-based resource providers.

name: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History - Student Programs & Student Volunteers
Yale Physics Professional Development - for graduate students and postdocs
mission:
The Yale Physics Professional Development Organization (YPPDO) is a student-led organization that aims to expose physics science graduate students and postdocs to non-academic career opportunities and prepare them for their career transition after Yale. Furthermore, along with the tangible deliverables of this program will hopefully come a culture change within the physics department and Science Hill in general, one that does not attach a stigma to pursuing work outside of academia. At the same time, graduate students who choose to stay in academia will be able to do so out of an informed choice and will be better equipped for the academic job search.
The 2015 GSAS STEM survey for physics PhD students revealed that 46% of surveyees have career goals that involve becoming faculty members, 63% agree that their program is preparing them for their current career goals, 29% agree that Career Services has been beneficial for their career development, and only 8% of students use the Office of Career Strategies ‘a fair amount’. According to our own departmental statistics over the last 20 years, only 11 out of 310 PhD graduates are currently registered in teacher/lecturer/faculty positions. These statistics highlight two main motivations for the YPPDO program: (1) over half of physics graduate students do not plan to pursue professorships and of those that do, only a few will be given the opportunity and (2) physics graduate students do not feel they are acquiring the skills to pursue work outside of the academy. 
Although this program and budget has originated within physics, we welcome students from all physical sciences across Science Hill to participate in events. In alignment with Yale’s mission to increase the visibility of STEM, we would be excited to work with our colleagues from closely-related departments such applied physics, astronomy, geology & geophysics, engineering, and chemistry to expand the YPPDO program and bring speakers from diverse geographic and educational backgrounds.

name: Yale Postdoctoral Association (YPA)
address: New Haven, Conn 06510 United States
mission: The Yale Postdoctoral Association (YPA) exists to support and enrich Yale’s mission in the pursuit of scholarship, education, preservation, and practice, through facilitating postdoctoral scholars at Yale University in their efforts toward the betterment of the University and society. Read more about our mission and bylaws here: https://ypa.yale.edu/what-ypa/mission-statement-and-bylaws

name: Yale Precision Marching Band
mission:
The Yale Bands is a thriving cultural community. Its members are given opportunities to prepare and perform great music; learn about the arts and their place in society and international cultures; and develop skills to become leaders.
